analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān sarvaśūram bodhisatvam mahāsatvam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­śūra:

original: dvāv imau sarvaśūra satvau dharmaparitṛṣitau / / katamau dvau /
analyzed: dvau imau sarva śūra satvau dharma paritṛṣitau katamau dvau
translated: Sarva­śūra, there are these two beings who are thirsty for the Dharma. Which two?

analyzed: yat uta ekaḥ sarva śūra sarva satva sama cittaḥ
translated: Namely, (1) one who has the thought of equality towards all beings, Sarva­śūra,

original: dvitīyaḥ sarvaśūra yo dharmaṃ śrutvā sarvasatvānāṃ samaṃ prakāśayati /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ sarva śūra yaḥ dharmam śrutvā sarva satvānām samam prakāśayati
translated: Second, Sarvaśūra, is the one who, having heard the Dharma, teaches it equally to all beings.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the Bodhisattva, said:

original: katamaṃ bhagavan dharmaṃ śrutvā sarvasatvānāṃ samaprakāśanā /
analyzed: katamam bhagavan dharmam śrutvā sarva satvānām sama prakāśanā
translated: Blessed One, what is the Dharma that, having heard it, one teaches equally to all beings?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ekaḥ sarvaśūra dharmaṃ śrutvā bodhāya pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: ekaḥ sarva śūra dharmam śrutvā bodhāya pariṇāmayati
translated: Sarvaśūra, the first is the one who, having heard the Dharma, dedicates it to enlightenment.🔽When one dedicates it to enlightenment, then all beings will be satisfied with the Dharma.

original: yadā ca bodhāya pariṇāmayati tadā sarvasatvā dharmaparitṛṣitā bhaviṣyanti / / dvitīyaḥ sarvaśūra yo mahāyānam avagāhayati /
analyzed: yadā ca bodhāya pariṇāmayati tadā sarva satvāḥ dharma paritṛṣitāḥ bhaviṣyanti dvitīyaḥ sarva śūra yaḥ mahāyānam avagāhayati
translated: Second, Sarvaśūra, is the one who enters the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: sa nityam dharma paritṛṣitaḥ bhavati
translated: He is always satisfied with the Dharma.

original: SaSūC atha te devanāgamanuṣyāpsarasakoṭya utthāyāsanād bhagavataḥ purataḥ prāṃjalayo bhūtvā bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: sasūc  atha te deva nāga manuṣya apsarasa koṭyaḥ utthāya āsanāt bhagavataḥ puratas prāṃjalayaḥ bhūtvā bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: Then those millions of gods, nāgas, humans, and celestial nymphs rose from their seats, placed their palms together in front of the Blessed One, and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: vayam bhagavan dharma paritṛṣitāḥ
translated: Blessed One, we are thirsty for the Dharma.

analyzed: paripūrayatu bhagavān asmākam sarva satvānām ca āśām
translated: May the Blessed One fulfill our hopes and those of all beings.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitaṃ prāduścakāra / / atha
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām smitam prāduścakāra atha
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One manifested a smile. Then

original: khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatva utthāyāsanād yena bhagavāṃs tenāṃjaliṃ praṇamayya
analyzed: khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ utthāya āsanāt yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamayya
translated: Indeed, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra, having risen from his seat, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition for the manifestation of a smile?

original: SaSūC atha khalu bhagavān sarvaśūraṃ bodhisatvaṃ mahāsatvaṃ āmantrayām āsa /
analyzed: sasūc atha khalu bhagavān sarvaśūram bodhisatvam mahāsatvam āmantrayām āsa
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra:

original: ye sarvaśūra satvā ihāgatvā te sarve anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyante /
analyzed: ye sarva śūra satvāḥ iha āgatvā te sarve anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyante
translated: Those beings, Sarvaśūra, who come here, they all attain the highest complete enlightenment.

analyzed: sarve te tathāgata gocara pariniṣpattaye pariniṣpadyante
translated: They all attain the perfection of the domain of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the bodhisattva said:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yad ete satvā ihagatvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyante /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat ete satvāḥ iha gatvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyante
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, that these beings, having come here, attain the highest complete enlightenment?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sādhu sādhu sarvaśūra yas tvaṃ tathāgatam etam arthaṃ paripraṣṭavyaṃ manyase / iha sarvaśūra pariṇāmanāviśeṣo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sarva śūra yaḥ tvam tathāgatam etam artham paripraṣṭavyam manyase iha sarva śūra pariṇāmanā viśeṣaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Good, good, Sarvaśūra, that you think to ask the Tathāgata about this matter. Here, Sarvaśūra, the excellence of the transformation should be seen.

original: SaSūC / bhūtapūrvaṃ sarvaśūrātīte 'dhvany asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpai ratnaśrīr nāma
analyzed: sasūc bhūta pūrvam sarva śūra atīte dhvani asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ ratnaśrīḥ nāma
translated: SuSū: In the past, O Sarvaśūra, countless eons ago, there appeared in the world a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, named Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loko udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid
analyzed: tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ lokaḥ udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid
translated: perfect in wisdom and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world,

original: anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: SaSūC tena khalu punaḥ sarvaśūra kālenāhaṃ māṇavako 'bhūvam / / ye satvāḥ
analyzed: sasūc tena khalu punar sarvaśūra kālena aham māṇavakaḥ bhūvam ye satvāḥ
translated: SuSū: At that time, O Sarvaśūra, I was a young brahmin.

original: sāṃprataṃ mayā buddhajñāne pratiṣṭhapitās te sarve tena kālena tena samayena mṛgā
analyzed: sāṃpratam mayā buddha jñāne pratiṣṭhapitāḥ te sarve tena kālena tena samayena mṛgāḥ
translated: Those beings who are now being established by me in the knowledge of the Buddha, they were all, at that time and at that moment, deer.

original: abhūvan / / tena ca kālena tena samayenāham evaṃ praṇidhānam akārṣaṃ /
analyzed: abhūvan tena ca kālena tena samayena aham evam praṇidhānam akārṣam
translated: And at that time and at that moment, I made this vow:

original: ye kecin mṛgāḥ sāṃprataṃ duḥkhena paripīḍitāḥ ete sarve mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeran /
analyzed: ye kecid mṛgāḥ sāṃpratam duḥkhena paripīḍitāḥ ete sarve mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeran
translated: Whatever deer are now suffering from pain, may they all be reborn in my Buddha-field.

original: sarvāṃś ca tān ahaṃ buddhajñāne pratiṣṭhāpayeyam / / te ca mṛgās tad vacanaṃ śrutvā evaṃ vācam abhāṣanta /
analyzed: sarvān ca tān aham buddha jñāne pratiṣṭhāpayeyam te ca mṛgāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā evam vācam abhāṣanta
translated: And I will establish them all in the knowledge of the Buddha. And those deer, having heard those words, spoke thus:

original: evaṃ bhavatu / / tena sarvaśūra kuśalamūlenaite satvā ihagatvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: evam bhavatu tena sarva śūra kuśala mūlena ete satvāḥ iha gatvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: By that root of merit, may those beings, having come here, fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: SaSūC atha khalu sarvaśuro bodhisatvo mahāsatvo bhagavato 'ntikād utsāhaṃ śrutvā bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: sasūc atha khalu sarvaśuraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt utsāham śrutvā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra, having heard encouragement from the Blessed One, said this to the Blessed One:

original: kiyantaṃ bhagavaṃs teṣāṃ satvānāṃ āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kiyantam bhagavan teṣām satvānām āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Blessed One, what will be the lifespan of those beings?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: aśīti kalpās teṣāṃ satvānām āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aśīti kalpāḥ teṣām satvānām āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: The lifespan of those beings will be eighty eons.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the bodhisattva, said:

analyzed: kim bhagavan kalpasya pramāṇam
translated: Blessed One, what is the measure of an eon?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: śṛṇu kula putra
translated: Listen, son of good family.

original: tadyathāpināma sarvaśūra kaścid eva puruṣo nagaraṃ kārayed /
analyzed: tat yathā apināma sarva śūra kaścid eva puruṣaḥ nagaram kārayet
translated: For example, Sarvaśūra, suppose some man were to build a city,

analyzed: dvādaśa yojana āyāma vistāram
translated: twelve yojanas long and wide,

analyzed: ūrdhvena trīṇi yojanāni pramāṇam
translated: three yojanas high,

original: tac ca nagaraṃ tilaphalakaiḥ paripūrṇaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tat ca nagaram tila phalakaiḥ paripūrṇam kuryāt
translated: and fill that city with sesame seeds.

original: atha sa puruṣo varṣaśatasyātyayāt tatas tilaphalakaiḥ paripūrṇān nagarād ekaṃ tilaphalakaṃ bahir nikṣiped /
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ varṣa śatasya atyayāt tatas tila phalakaiḥ paripūrṇāt nagarāt ekam tila phalakam bahis nikṣipet
translated: Then, after the passing of a hundred years, that man would remove one sesame seed from that city.

original: anena paryāyeṇa sa puruṣaḥ sarvāṇi tāni tilaphalakāni kṣayaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sa puruṣaḥ sarvāṇi tāni tila phalakāni kṣayam kuryāt
translated: In this way, that man would exhaust all those sesame seeds.

original: tac ca nagaram amūlam apratiṣṭhānāṃ bhaven /
analyzed: tat ca nagaram amūlam apratiṣṭhānām bhavet
translated: And that city would be without a foundation or support.

analyzed: na ca adya api ca kalpam kṣīyeta
translated: And even now, an eon would not be exhausted.

analyzed: sasūc    punar aparam sarva śūra
translated: Again, Sarva-shura,

analyzed: tat yathā apināma parvataḥ bhavet
translated: it is just as if there were a mountain,

analyzed: paṃcaviṃśat yojanāni pramāṇena
translated: twenty-five yojanas in extent,

analyzed: dvādaśa yojanāni ūrdhvena
translated: twelve yojanas high,

original: atha kaścid eva puruṣas tasya parvatasya pārśve gṛhaṃ kārayet /
analyzed: atha kaścid eva puruṣaḥ tasya parvatasya pārśve gṛham kārayet
translated: and then some man would build a house on the side of that mountain,

original: sa dīrghasyādhvano varṣaśatasyātyayena kāśikena vastreṇaikavārāṃ parimārjayed /
analyzed: sa dīrghasya adhvanaḥ varṣa śatasya atyayena kāśikena vastreṇa eka vārām parimārjayet
translated: and after a long time, after a hundred years had passed, he would wipe it once with a silken cloth.

original: evaṃ kṛtvā tasya parvatasya kṣayo bhaven /
analyzed: evam kṛtvā tasya parvatasya kṣayaḥ bhavet
translated: In this way, the exhaustion of that mountain would occur,

original: na ca kalpaṃ kṣīyeta / etat sarvaśūra kalpasya pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: na ca kalpam kṣīyeta etat sarva śūra kalpasya pramāṇam
translated: but an eon would not be exhausted. This, Sarva-shura, is the measure of an eon.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatva utthāyāsanād /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ utthāya āsanāt
translated: Then indeed the Bodhisattva-mahasattva Sarva-shura rose from his seat,

analyzed: eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam kṛtvā
translated: Having arranged the upper robe over one shoulder,

analyzed: dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya
translated: placing the right knee on the ground,

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇāmya
translated: bowing to the Blessed One with palms joined,

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: he said this to the Blessed One:

original: ekapariṇāmanayā bhagavann evaṃ bahu puṇyaskandhaṃ prasavati yad utāśītiḥ kalpān sukham āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: eka pariṇāmanayā bhagavan evam bahu puṇya skandham prasavati yat uta aśītiḥ kalpān sukham āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Blessed One, by this single dedication, one produces so much merit, namely, one's life-span will be eighty thousand eons of happiness.

original: kaḥ punar vādo yas tathāgataśāsane bahutaram adhikāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ tathāgata śāsane bahutaram adhikāram kariṣyati
translated: What to speak of one who will perform much service to the Tathāgata's teaching?

analyzed: sasūc   bhagavān āha śṛṇu kula putra
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, son of good family.

original: ya imaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ sūtraṃ śroṣyati tasya caturaśītiḥ kalpasahasrāṇy āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati / kaḥ punar vādo yaḥ saṃghāṭaṃ sūtraṃ likhiṣyati
analyzed: yaḥ imam saṃghāṭam sūtram śroṣyati tasya caturaśītiḥ kalpa sahasrāṇi āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ saṃghāṭam sūtram likhiṣyati
translated: He who will hear this Saṃghāṭa Sūtra will have a life-span of eighty-four thousand eons. What to speak of one who will write the Saṃghāṭa Sūtra🔽that being will produce a much greater heap of merit.

original: sa sarvaśūra satvo bahutaraṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyati / / yaḥ sarvaśūra prasannacittaḥ
analyzed: sa sarva śūra satvaḥ bahutaram puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati yaḥ sarva śūra prasanna cittaḥ
translated: All-victorious one, he who with a clear mind

original: saṃghāṭaṃ sūtram adhyāśayena namaskariṣyati sa paṃcanavati kalpāṃ jātau jātismaro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saṃghāṭam sūtram adhyāśayena namaskariṣyati sa paṃcanavati kalpām jātau jātismaraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: will pay homage to the Saṃghāṭa Sūtra with a superior intention will be reborn with the ability to remember past lives for ninety-five eons.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭi kalpa sahasrāṇi rājā cakravartī bhaviṣyati
translated: For sixty thousand eons he will be a universal monarch.

original: dṛṣṭa eva dharme sarvaśūra sarveṣāṃ priyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dṛṣṭe eva dharme sarva śūra sarveṣām priyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In this very life, Sarvaśūra, he will be dear to all.

original: na sa sarvaśūra śastreṇa kālaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: na sa sarva śūra śastreṇa kālam kariṣyati
translated: Sarvaśūra, he will not die by a weapon.

analyzed: kākhordam ca asya na kramiṣyati
translated: No poison will affect him.

original: maraṇakāle ca navati buddhākoṭyaḥ saṃmukhaṃ drakṣyati /
analyzed: maraṇa kāle ca navati buddhā koṭyaḥ saṃmukham drakṣyati
translated: At the time of death he will see ninety koṭis of Buddhas face to face.

original: te ca sarvaśūra buddhā bhagavanta āśvāsayanti /
analyzed: te ca sarva śūra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ āśvāsayanti
translated: And those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, will console him, Sarvaśūra.

analyzed: mā bhaiḥ sat puruṣa
translated: 'Do not be afraid, good man.

original: tvayā saṃghāṭaṃ sūtraṃ mahādharmaparyāyaṃ subhāṣitaṃ śrutaṃ śrutvā iyān puṇyaskandhaḥ
analyzed: tvayā saṃghāṭam sūtram mahā dharmaparyāyam su bhāṣitam śrutam śrutvā iyān puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: By listening to the well-spoken Saṃghāṭa Sūtra, the great teaching, you have produced such a great mass of merit.

original: prasūtaḥ / / te ca paṃcanavati buddhakoṭyaḥ pṛthak pṛthag lokadhātuṣu vyākariṣyanti /
analyzed: prasūtaḥ te ca paṃcanavati buddha koṭyaḥ pṛthak pṛthak lokadhātuṣu vyākariṣyanti
translated: And those ninety-five koṭis of Buddhas will prophesy separately in different world systems.

original: kaḥ punar vādaḥ sarvaśūra ya imaṃ saṃghāṭasūtraṃ mahādharmaparyāyaṃ sakalasamāptaṃ vistareṇa śroṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ sarva śūra yaḥ imam saṃghāṭa sūtram mahā dharmaparyāyam sakala samāptam vistareṇa śroṣyati
translated: To say nothing, Sarvaśūra, of one who will listen to the entire Saṃghāṭa Sūtra, the great teaching, in detail.'

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatvo bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: aham bhagavan saṃghāṭasūtram mahā dharmaparyāyam śroṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, I will listen to the Saṃghāṭa Sūtra, the great Dharma discourse.

analyzed: kiyantam bhagavan puṇya skandham prasaviṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, how much merit will I generate?

original: bhagavān āha /🔽yāvanto gaṃgānadībālikāsamānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ puṇyaskandhas /
analyzed: bhagavān āha  yāvantaḥ gaṃgā nadībālikā samānām buddhānām bhagavatām puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tāvantaṃ sarvaśūra sa satvaḥ puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: tāvantam sarva śūra sa satvaḥ puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: Sarvaśūra, that being will generate a heap of merit equal to the heap of merit of Buddhas, Blessed Ones, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the Bodhisattva Sarvaśūra said:

original: yad ahaṃ bhagavan saṃghāṭasūtraṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇomi /
analyzed: yat aham bhagavan saṃghāṭasūtram dharmaparyāyam śṛṇomi
translated: Blessed One, when I listen to the Saṃghāṭa Sūtra, the Dharma discourse,

original: nāhaṃ bhagavaṃs tṛptiṃ saṃjānāmi / / bhagavān āha /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan tṛptim saṃjānāmi bhagavān āha
translated: Blessed One, I do not feel satisfied. The Blessed One said:

original: sādhu sādhu sarvaśūra yas tvaṃ dharmāṇāṃ tṛptiṃ na saṃjānāsi / aham api sarvaśūra dharmāṇāṃ tṛptiṃ na saṃjānāmi /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sarva śūra yaḥ tvam dharmāṇām tṛptim na saṃjānāsi aham api sarva śūra dharmāṇām tṛptim na saṃjānāmi
translated: Excellent, excellent, Sarvaśūra, that you do not feel satisfied with the teachings. I too, Sarvaśūra, do not feel satisfied with the teachings.

original: kaḥ punar vādaḥ sarvaśūra yad bālapṛthagjanās tṛptiṃ jñāsyanti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ sarva śūra yat bāla pṛthagjanāḥ tṛptim jñāsyanti
translated: What need is there, Sarvaśūra, for foolish ordinary beings to feel satisfied?

original: SaSūC / yaḥ kaścit sarvaśūra kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā mahāyāne prasādaṃ janayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sasūc    yaḥ kaścid sarva śūra kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā mahāyāne prasādam janayiṣyanti
translated: Sarvaśūra, any son or daughter of good family who generates faith in the Mahāyāna,

analyzed: sa kalpa sahasram vinipātam na gamiṣyati
translated: will not fall into the lower realms for a thousand eons.

analyzed: paṃca kalpa sahasrāṇi tiryakṣuḥ na upapatsyate
translated: For five thousand eons, he will not be reborn as an animal.

analyzed: dvādaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi durbuddhiḥ sa bhavisyati
translated: For twelve thousand eons, he will have bad thoughts.

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi pratyantimeṣu janapadeṣu na upapatsyate
translated: For eighteen thousand eons, he will not be reborn in the border regions.

analyzed: viṃśati kalpa sahasrāṇi pradāna śūraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For twenty thousand eons, he will be a hero in giving.

analyzed: paṃcaviṃśat kalpa sahasrāṇi deva lokeṣu upapatsyate
translated: For twenty-five thousand eons, he will be reborn in the heavens.

analyzed: paṃcatriṃśat kalpa sahasrāṇi brahmacaryam cariṣyati
translated: For thirty-five thousand eons, he will practice celibacy.

analyzed: sa catvāriṃśat kalpa sahasrāṇi niṣkrānta gṛha āvāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For forty thousand eons, he will leave the household life.

analyzed: paṃcāśat kalpa sahasrāṇi dharma dharaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For fifty thousand eons, he will uphold the Dharma.

analyzed: paṃcaṣaṣṭiḥ kalpa sahasrāṇi maraṇa anusmṛtim bhāvayiṣyati
translated: For sixty-five thousand eons, he will cultivate mindfulness of death.

original: tasya sarvaśūra kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā na kiṃcit pāpakāni karmāṇi saṃvetsyante /
analyzed: tasya sarva śūra kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā na kiṃcid pāpakāni karmāṇi saṃvetsyante
translated: O Sarvaśūra, for that noble son or noble daughter, no evil actions will be experienced.

original: na ca tasya māraḥ pāpīmān avatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: na ca tasya māraḥ pāpīmān avatāram lapsyate
translated: And Māra the evil one will not find an opportunity.

original: na jātu mātukukṣāv upapatsyate / / ye sarvaśūra imaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: na jātu mātu kukṣau upapatsyate ye sarva śūraḥ imam saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam śroṣyanti
translated: He will never be reborn in a mother's womb. Those who will hear this Dharma discourse called Saṃghāṭa, O Sarvaśūra,

original: te yatra yatropapatsyante tatra tatra paṃcanavatyāsaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpair vinipātaṃ na gamiṣyanti / / aśītiḥ kalpasahasrāṇi śrutadharā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te yatra yatra upapatsyante tatra tatra paṃcanavatyā asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ vinipātam na gamiṣyanti aśītiḥ kalpa sahasrāṇi śrutadharāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: For eighty thousand eons they will be holders of the teachings.

analyzed: kalpa śata sahasram prāṇātipātāt prativiratāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: For a hundred thousand eons they will abstain from killing.

analyzed: nava anavati kalpa sahasrāṇi mṛṣāvādāt prativiratāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: For ninety-nine thousand eons they will abstain from false speech.🔽For thirteen thousand eons they will abstain from slander.

original: trayodaśa kalpasahasrāṇi piśunavacanāt prativiratā bhaviṣyanti / / durlabhās te sarvaśūra satvā ya iman dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: trayodaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi piśuna vacanāt prativiratāḥ bhaviṣyanti durlabhāḥ te sarva śūra satvāḥ ye iman dharmaparyāyam śroṣyanti
translated: Those beings, Sarva-shura, who will listen to this Dharma discourse, are rare.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatva utthāyāsanād /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ utthāya āsanāt
translated: Then the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva Sarva-shura rose from his seat,

analyzed: eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam kṛtvā
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder,

analyzed: dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya
translated: placed his right knee on the ground,

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands,

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: and said to the Blessed One:

original: kiyantaṃ bhagavaṃs te satvā apuṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyanti ya iman dharmaparyāyaṃ pratikṣepsyanti /
analyzed: kiyantam bhagavan te satvāḥ apuṇya skandham prasaviṣyanti ye iman dharmaparyāyam pratikṣepsyanti
translated: Blessed One, how much demerit will those beings create who reject this Dharma discourse?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: bahu sarva śūra saddharma pratikṣepāt apuṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: Sarvaśūra, there will be a great deal of demerit produced from the rejection of the true Dharma.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra said:

original: kiyantaṃ bhagavan satvānāṃ pāpakaṃ karmaskandhaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kiyantam bhagavan satvānām pāpakam karma skandham bhaviṣyati
translated: How much demerit will beings have, Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: alam alam sarva śūra
translated: Enough, enough, Sarvaśūra.

analyzed: mā me pāpakam karma skandham paripṛccha
translated: Do not ask me about the heap of demerit.

original: yaś ca sarvaśūra dvādaśagaṃgānadībālikāsamānān tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānām antike duṣṭacittam utpādayed /
analyzed: yaḥ ca sarva śūra dvādaśa gaṃgā nadībālikā samānān tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antike duṣṭa cittam utpādayet
translated: Sarvaśūra, he who would arouse an evil mind towards Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones as numerous as the sands of twelve Ganges Rivers,

analyzed: yaḥ ca imam saṃghāṭa sūtram pratikṣipet
translated: and he who would reject this Saṃghāṭa Sūtra,🔽would produce a heap of demerit even greater than that.

original: ayaṃ tato bahutaraṃ pāpakam akuśalaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyati / / ato 'pi sarvaśūra bahutaram akuśalaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyanti ye mahāyāne āghātacittam
analyzed: ayam tatas bahutaram pāpakam akuśala skandham prasaviṣyati atas sarva śūra bahutaram akuśala skandham prasaviṣyanti ye mahāyāne āghāta cittam
translated: Sarvaśūra, those who arouse a hostile mind towards the Mahāyāna

original: dagdhās te sarvaśūra satvā dagdhā eva/
analyzed: dagdhāḥ te sarva śūra satvāḥ dagdhāḥ eva
translated: will be burned, Sarvaśūra, those beings will be burned.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavaṃs te satvā śakyaṃ mocayituṃ /
analyzed: katham bhagavan te satvā śakyam mocayitum
translated: How can those beings, Blessed One, be liberated?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra
translated: Just so, Sarvaśūra.

original: tadyathāpināma sarvaśūra kaścid eva puruṣaḥ kasyacit satvasya śīrṣaṃ cchiṃdyād tasya punaḥ kenacid bhaiṣajyena praliṃpen /
analyzed: tat yathā apināma sarva śūra kaścid eva puruṣaḥ kasyacid satvasya śīrṣam chiṃdyāt tasya punar kenacid bhaiṣajyena praliṃpen
translated: Suppose, Sarva-shura, that some man were to cut off the head of some being, and then some person were to smear it with some medicine,

original: mākṣikena vā śarkarayā vā guḍena vā ghṛtena vā tailena vā taṃ śīrṣaṃ pralepayet / / śakyaṃ sarvaśūra sa satvaḥ punar api utthāpayituṃ /
analyzed: mākṣikena vā śarkarayā vā guḍena vā ghṛtena vā tailena vā tam śīrṣam pralepayet  śakyam sarva śūra sa satvaḥ punar api utthāpayitum
translated: with honey, sugar, molasses, ghee, or oil, and smear that head. Sarva-shura, it is possible that that being could be revived again.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarva-shura, the Bodhisattva, said:

analyzed: na śakyam bhagavan
translated: No, Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: sasūc    punar aparam sarva śūra
translated: Moreover, Sarva-shura,

analyzed: tat yathā apināma dvitīyaḥ puruṣaḥ bhavet
translated: it is just as if there were a second person,

original: sa tīkṣṇena śastreṇāparasya satvasya prahāraṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: sa tīkṣṇena śastreṇa aparasya satvasya prahāram dadyāt
translated: who with a sharp weapon would strike another being,

original: sa na śaknuyād ekaprahāreṇa jīvitād vyavaropayituṃ /
analyzed: sa na śaknuyāt eka prahāreṇa jīvitāt vyavaropayitum
translated: and would not be able to deprive him of life with one blow.

original: kiṃ cāpi sarvaśūra tasya vraṇam utpadyeta /
analyzed: kim ca api sarva śūra tasya vraṇam utpadyeta
translated: Moreover, Sarva-shura, a wound would arise for him,

original: atha ca punar bhaiṣajyayogaṃ kartavyaṃ tadā vraṇāt parimucyate /
analyzed: atha ca punar bhaiṣajya yogam kartavyam tadā vraṇāt parimucyate
translated: but then a medicinal preparation should be made, then he would be freed from the wound.

original: yadā parimukto bhavati tadā duḥkhaṃ smarati /
analyzed: yadā parimuktaḥ bhavati tadā duḥkham smarati
translated: When he is freed, then he remembers the suffering.

analyzed: aham idānīm jānāmi
translated: Now I know,

original: na kadācit punaḥ pāpakam akuśalaṃ karmābhisaṃskāraṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: na kadācid punar pāpakam akuśalam karma abhisaṃskāram kariṣyāmi
translated: I will never again create any evil, unwholesome actions.”

original: SaSūC / evam eva sarvaśūra sa puruṣo yadā narake duḥkhaṃ smarati tadā sarvapāpaṃ parivarjayati /
analyzed: sasūc    evam eva sarva śūra sa puruṣaḥ yadā narake duḥkham smarati tadā sarva pāpam parivarjayati
translated: “In the same way, Sarva­śūra, when that person remembers the suffering in the hells, then he abandons all evil.

analyzed: tadā sarva dharmān āmukhīkariṣyati
translated: Then he will bring all dharmas to mind.🔽Having brought all dharmas to mind, he will complete all wholesome dharmas.”

original: sarvadharmān āmukhīkṛtvā sarvakuśaladharmapāripūriṃ kariṣyati / / tadyathāpināma sarvaśūra mṛtasya puruṣasya mātāpitarau /
analyzed: sarva dharmān ā mukhīkṛtvā sarva kuśala dharma pāripūrim kariṣyati tat yathā apināma sarva śūra mṛtasya puruṣasya mātā pitarau
translated: “It is just as, Sarva­śūra, when the parents of a dead person

original: śocanti paridevanti na ca śaknuvanti trātum /
analyzed: śocanti paridevanti na ca śaknuvanti trātum
translated: mourn and lament, but are unable to save them.

original: evam eva sarvaśūra bālapṛthagjanāḥ satvā na śaknuvanty ātmahitaṃ parahitaṃ vā kartuṃ /
analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra bāla pṛthagjanāḥ satvāḥ na śaknuvanti ātma hitam para hitam vā kartum
translated: In the same way, Sarva­śūra, foolish ordinary beings are unable to do what is beneficial for themselves or others.

analyzed: nirāśāḥ iva mātā pitaraḥ
translated: Like parents who are hopeless.

original: evam eva sarvaśūra nirāśā bhavanti te satvā maraṇakālasamaye /
analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra nirāśāḥ bhavanti te satvāḥ maraṇa kāla samaye
translated: In the same way, Sarva­śūra, beings are hopeless at the time of death.

original: SaSūC / dvāv imau sarvaśūra satvau nirāśau / katamau dvau /
analyzed: sasūc    dvau imau sarva śūra satvau nirāśau katamau dvau
translated: “There are these two hopeless beings, Sarva­śūra. Which two?

original: yad utaikaḥ satvaḥ pāpaṃ karma karoti kārāpayati vā / dvitīyaḥ saddharmaṃ pratikṣipati / imau dvau satvau nirāśau maraṇakālasamaye /
analyzed: yat uta ekaḥ satvaḥ pāpam karma karoti kārāpayati vā dvitīyaḥ saddharmam pratikṣipati imau dvau satvau nirāśau maraṇa kāla samaye
translated: Namely, one being commits evil deeds or causes them to be done, and a second one rejects the true Dharma. These two beings are hopeless at the time of death.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the Bodhisattva, said:

original: kā bhadanta bhagavaṃs teṣāṃ satvānāṃ gatiḥ /
analyzed: kā bhadanta bhagavan teṣām satvānām gatiḥ
translated: What, Bhadanta Blessed One, is the destiny of those beings?

analyzed: kaḥ bhisaṃparāyaḥ bhavati
translated: What is their future state?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: anantā gatiḥ sarva śūra saddharma pratikṣepakānām satvānām
translated: Sarvaśūra, the destiny of those beings who reject the true Dharma is endless.

analyzed: anantaḥ bhisaṃparāyaḥ
translated: The future state is endless.

original: kalpam eva te sarvaśūra raurave mahānarake duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ vedayiṣyanti /
analyzed: kalpam eva te sarva śūra raurave mahā narake duḥkhām vedanām vedayiṣyanti
translated: Sarvaśūra, they will experience suffering for an eon in the Raurava great hell.

analyzed: kalpam saṃghāte  kalpam tapane
translated: For an eon in the Saṃghāta.🔽For an eon in the Tapana.

analyzed: kalpam pratāpane  kalpam kālasūtre mahānarake
translated: For an eon in the Pratāpana.🔽For an eon in the Kālasūtra great hell.

analyzed: kalpam mahāvīcau mahānarake
translated: For an eon in the Mahāvīci great hell.

analyzed: kalpam romaharṣe mahānarake
translated: For an eon in the Romaharṣaṇa great hell.

original: kalpaṃ hahave mahānarake / / imeṣv aṣṭasu mahānarakeṣu sarvaśūra aṣṭau kalpāḥ saddharmapratikṣepakaiḥ satvair duḥkham anubhavitavyam /
analyzed: kalpam hahave mahānarake imeṣu aṣṭasu mahānarakeṣu sarvaśūra aṣṭau kalpāḥ saddharma pratikṣepakaiḥ satvaiḥ duḥkham anubhavitavyam
translated: For an eon in the Hāhava great hell. In these eight great hells, Sarvaśūra, beings who reject the true Dharma must experience suffering for eight eons.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatvo bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Suuc: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sarva-shura said this to the Blessed One:

original: duḥkhaṃ bhagavan duḥkhaṃ sugata notsahāmi śrotuṃ/
analyzed: duḥkham bhagavan duḥkham sugata na utsahāmi śrotum
translated: It is suffering, Blessed One, it is suffering, Sugata. I am not able to listen.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyām imā gāthā abhāṣata /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time:

original: kim tvaṃ notsahase śrotum idaṃ vākyaṃ mahābhayam /
analyzed: kim tvam na utsahase śrotum idam vākyam mahā bhayam
translated: Why are you not able to listen to this statement of great fear?

analyzed: narakām duḥkha saṃyogā satvāḥ vindanti vedanām
translated: Beings in the hells experience feelings of suffering due to their connection with suffering.

original: yat karoti śubhaṃ karma sukhaṃ tasya bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yat karoti śubham karma sukham tasya bhaviṣyati
translated: Whatever good deeds one does, that will be happiness for them.

original: yat karoty aśubhaṃ karma duḥkham eva bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: yat karoti aśubham karma duḥkham eva bhaviṣyati
translated: Whatever bad deeds one does, that will only be suffering.

original: jātasya maraṇaṃ duḥkhaṃ śokaṃ duḥkho 'tha bandhanaṃ /
analyzed: jātasya maraṇam duḥkham śokam bandhanam
translated: Birth is suffering, death is suffering, grief is suffering, and bondage is suffering.

original: nityaṃ duḥkhaṃ hi bālasya sukhaheto na vetti yaḥ //
analyzed: nityam duḥkham hi bālasya sukha hetoḥ na vetti yaḥ
translated: The fool always experiences suffering, not knowing the cause of happiness.

original: paṇḍitānāṃ sukhaṃ yo vai smarate buddhadakṣiṇāṃ /
analyzed: paṇḍitānām sukham yaḥ vai smarate buddha dakṣiṇām
translated: Those who remember the Buddha's gift, which is happiness for the wise,

original: prasannāś ca mahāyāne na te yāsyanti durgatim //
analyzed: prasannāḥ ca mahāyāne na te yāsyanti durgatim
translated: and have faith in the Mahayana, they will not go to the lower realms.

analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra pūrva karma pracoditam
translated: In the same way, Sarva-shura, it is impelled by previous karma.

original: alpaṃ hi kṛyate karma mahāntaṃ bhujyate phalaṃ //
analyzed: alpam hi kṛyate karma mahāntam bhujyate phalam
translated: A small deed is done, but a great result is experienced.

original: bījam alpaṃ yathā vāpya prabhūtaṃ labhate phalaṃ /
analyzed: bījam alpam yathā vāpya prabhūtam labhate phalam
translated: Just as a small seed sown in a good field yields abundant fruit,

original: buddhakṣetre tu sukṣetre vījaṃ vai yatra rūhyate //
analyzed: buddhakṣetre tu su kṣetre vījam vai yatra rūhyate
translated: so the seed sown in the Buddha-field, the good field,

analyzed: paṇḍitānām sukham bhavati ramante jina śāsane
translated: The wise ones find happiness, they delight in the teachings of the Victorious Ones.

analyzed: vivarjayanti pāpāni kurvanti kuśalam bahu
translated: They avoid evil deeds and perform much that is wholesome.

original: āṇumātraṃ pradāsyanti ye dānaṃ mama śāsane /
analyzed: āṇu mātram pradāsyanti ye dānam mama śāsane
translated: Those who give even a small amount in my teachings,

analyzed: aśītiḥ kalpa sahasrāṇi mahā bhogāḥ mahā dhanāḥ
translated: for eighty thousand eons they will have great enjoyments and great wealth.

original: yatra yatropapadyante nityaṃ dānaṃ smaranti te /
analyzed: yatra yatra upapadyante nityam dānam smaranti te
translated: Wherever they are reborn, they always remember giving.

original: evaṃ mahāphalā hy eṣā gaṃbhīrā buddhadakṣiṇā //
analyzed: evam mahā phalā hi eṣā gaṃbhīrā buddha dakṣiṇā
translated: Thus this profound offering to the Buddha has great fruit.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatvo bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra said this to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan bhagavataḥ śāsane dharmo jñātavyaḥ /
analyzed: katham bhagavan bhagavataḥ śāsane dharmaḥ jñātavyaḥ
translated: Blessed One, how should the Dharma be known in the Blessed One's teachings?

original: kathaṃ bhagavan saṃghāṭaṃ sūtraṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā kuśalamūlaṃ parigṛhītaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: katham bhagavan saṃghāṭam sūtram dharmaparyāyam śrutvā kuśala mūlam parigṛhītam bhaviṣyati
translated: Blessed One, how will the wholesome roots be taken up by listening to the Saṃghāṭa Sūtra, the Dharma discourse?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Good, good, Sarvaśūra!

original: yaḥ sarvaśūra dvādaśagaṃgānadībālikāsamāṃs tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān sarvasukhopadhānairupatiṣṭheta /
analyzed: yaḥ sarva śūra dvādaśa gaṃgā nadībālikā samān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān sarva sukha upadhānaiḥ upatiṣṭheta
translated: Sarvaśūra, if one were to serve with all the requisites for happiness as many Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones as there are grains of sand in twelve Ganges Rivers,

original: yaś cemaṃ saṃghāṭasūtraṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇuyād evam eva tasya puṇyaskandho jñātavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca imam saṃghāṭasūtram dharmaparyāyam śṛṇuyāt evam eva tasya puṇya skandhaḥ jñātavyaḥ
translated: and if another were to listen to this Dharma discourse called The Great Collection, the accumulation of merit of the latter would be just the same as that of the former.

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the Bodhisattva, said:🔽Blessed One, how should the roots of virtue be fulfilled?

a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents,

analyzed: sa caturṣu dvīpa kṣetreṣu tilam vāpayet 🔽sarvaśūraḥ āha 🔽bahūni bhagavan bahūni sugata

original: śaknuyāt sa satvas tāni tilaphalakāni gaṇayituṃ vopamāṃ kartum /

analyzed: sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha

analyzed: no hi idam bhagavan

analyzed: no hi idam sugata

analyzed: na śakyam tāni tila phalakāni gaṇayitum
translated: It is not possible to count those sesame seeds.

analyzed: sasūc bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: anyatra tathāgatena tat yathā

analyzed: te sarve saṃghāṭasya dharmaparyāyasya nāmaṃparikīrteyeyuḥ

analyzed: śravaṇa kuśala mūla puṇyam ca parikīrtayeyuḥ

original: na śakyam upamāṃ kartum / / kaḥ punar vādo yo likhiṣyati vācayiṣyati /
analyzed: na śakyam upamām kartum kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ likhiṣyati vācayiṣyati
translated: It cannot be compared to anything. What need is there to speak of one who would write it out or recite it?

analyzed: sasūc sarva śūraḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: Sarvaśūra, the Bodhisattva, said:

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: sasūc    dvitīyām upamām śṛṇu sarva śūra

analyzed: tat yathā apināma yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasryām lokadhātau śilān vā  prapātān  mṛttikān vā  paramāṇu rajaḥ vā

analyzed: tat kim manyase sarva śūra
translated: What do you think, Sarvaśūra?

original: evam eva sarvaśūra na śakyaṃ saṃghāṭasūtrasya dharmaparyāyasya likhyamānasya puṇyaskandhopamāṃ kartum / / yāvantaṃ teṣāṃ rājñāṃ cakravartināṃ
analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra na śakyam saṃghāṭasūtrasya dharmaparyāyasya likhyamānasya puṇya skandha upamām kartum yāvantam teṣām rājñām cakravartinām

analyzed: bahutaram tasya puṇyam vadāmi

translated: The merit of that is not able to be surpassed by the merit of the writing of this Dharma discourse called The Great Collection.🔽The merit of that is not able to be compared to this.

original: tan na śakyam upamāṃ kartuṃ / / imaṃ sarvaśūra saṃghāṭaṃ sūtraṃ puṇyanidhānāni darśayati /
analyzed: tat na śakyam upamām kartum imam sarva śūra saṃghāṭam sūtram puṇya nidhānāni darśayati
translated: All-victorious one, this discourse on the Great Collection shows the treasures of merit,

analyzed: sarva kleśān upaśamayati

analyzed: sarva dharma ulkām jvālayati
translated: kindles the torch of all dharmas,

analyzed: sarva mārān pāpīmataḥ parājayati

analyzed: sarva bodhisatva bhavanāni ujvālayati
translated: illuminates all the abodes of the bodhisattvas,

analyzed: sarva dharma nirhārān abhinirharati

translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra said to the Blessed One:

original: iha bhagavan brahmacaryaṃ paramaduṣkaracaryā / / tat kasya hetoḥ /

analyzed: durlabhā bhagavan tathāgata caryā

analyzed: rātṛndivam ca tathāgata darśanam bhaviṣyati

original: yadā ca tathāgataṃ paśyati tadā buddhakṣetraṃ paśyati /

original: na sa jātu mātuḥ kukṣāv upapatsyate /

analyzed: na ca tṛṣṇā pāśena baddhaḥ bhaviṣyati  sasūc    evam ukte bhagavān sarvaśūram bodhisatvam mahāsatvam etat avocat

translated: Those who will bring the sound of this Saṃghāṭa Dharma-Discourse into the range of their ears,

analyzed: diśi paṃcaviṃśati gaṃgā nadī bālikā samān buddhān bhagavataḥ saṃmukham drakṣyati  diśi viṃśati gaṃgā nadī bālikā samān buddhām bhagavataḥ saṃmukham drakṣyati  ūrdhvāyām diśi navati koṭī sahasrāṇi buddhānām bhagavatām saṃmukham drakṣyati

translated: He said, I see, Blessed One, I see, Sugata. The Blessed One said,

analyzed: sasūc   āha śṛṇu kula putra

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat

translated: he sat down in front of the Blessed One.

original: bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitaḥ / / tatra ca sarve brāhmaṇānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthāḥ sannipatitāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ puratas sthitaḥ tatra ca sarve brāhmaṇāḥ anyatīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthāḥ sannipatitāḥ
translated: And there all the Brahmins, non-Buddhists, medical practitioners, wandering mendicants, and Jains assembled,

analyzed: bahavaḥ ca deva nāga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ
translated: and many gods, nagas, humans, and non-humans.

analyzed: paṃca mātrāṇi ca rāja śatāni sa parivārāṇi sannipatitāni
translated: And five hundred kings with their retinues assembled,

original: triṃśat koṭīsahasrāṇi mārāṇāṃ pāpīyasāṃ saparivārāḥ sannipatitā /
analyzed: triṃśat koṭī sahasrāṇi mārāṇām pāpīyasām sa parivārāḥ sannipatitā
translated: and thirty thousand koṭis of evil Māras with their retinues assembled.🔽Then at that time the great city of Rājagṛha shook.

original: SaSūC / tena khalu punaḥ samayena rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ prakaṃpitam / / atha khalu daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu divyaṃ candanacūrṇaṃ pravarṣitaṃ /
analyzed: sasūc    tena khalu punar samayena rājagṛham mahā nagaram prakaṃpitam atha khalu daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu divyam candana cūrṇam pravarṣitam
translated: And then divine sandalwood powder rained down from the ten directions of the world-realm,🔽and a rain of divine flowers rained down.

original: divyaṃ ca puṣpavarṣaṃ pravarṣitaṃ / / tad bhagavato mūrdhasandhau kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: divyam ca puṣpa varṣam pravarṣitam tat bhagavataḥ mūrdha sandhau kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ
translated: It formed a peaked dwelling on the Blessed One's head.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena tathāgatasya purataḥ śakro devānām indraḥ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena tathāgatasya puratas śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: And at that time Śakra, Lord of the Gods, stood in front of the Tathāgata,

analyzed: sa vajreṇa bhūmim parāhanat
translated: and struck the ground with his thunderbolt.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu tasmin samaye caturdiśaṃ catvāro vātarājāna utthāya pravānti /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu tasmin samaye caturdiśam catvāraḥ vāta rājānaḥ utthāya pravānti
translated: Then at that time the four kings of the wind rose up from the four directions and blew strongly,

original: ye ca rājagṛhe mahānagare saṃkarā vā /🔽pāṃsavo vā /
analyzed: ye ca rāja gṛhe mahā nagare saṃkarāḥ vā  pāṃsavaḥ vā
translated: And whatever dust or

analyzed: bālikā vā
translated: sand or🔽gravel there was in the great city of Rājagṛha,

original: tat sarvaṃ nagarād bahiḥ prakṣipanti /🔽daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gandhodakavarṣaṃ pravarṣanti /
analyzed: tat sarvam nagarāt bahis prakṣipanti  daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gandha udaka varṣam pravarṣanti
translated: all that was thrown outside the city.🔽In the world systems in the ten directions, a rain of fragrant water fell.

analyzed: daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīkāṇi pravarṣanti
translated: In the world systems in the ten directions, a rain of blue, red, and white lotuses fell.

original: te ca puṣpās teṣāṃ satvānām upari murdhni puṣpacchatrāṇi tasthire /
analyzed: te ca puṣpāḥ teṣām satvānām upari murdhni puṣpa chatrāṇi tasthire
translated: And those flowers stood as flower parasols above the heads of those beings.

original: tathāgatasya copari murdhni / / upary antarīkṣe caturaśītiḥ kūṭāgārasahasrāṇi saṃsthitāni /
analyzed: tathāgatasya ca upari murdhni upari antarīkṣe caturaśītiḥ kūṭāgāra sahasrāṇi saṃsthitāni
translated: And above the head of the Tathāgata, in the sky, eighty-four thousand kūṭāgāras appeared.

original: teṣu ca caturaśītiṣu puṣpakūṭāgārasahasreṣu caturaśīti sahasrāṇy āsanānāṃ prajñaptāni saptaratnamayāni prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: teṣu ca caturaśītiṣu puṣpa kūṭāgāra sahasreṣu caturaśīti sahasrāṇi āsanānām prajñaptāni sapta ratna mayāni prādurbhūtāni
translated: And in those eighty-four thousand flower kūṭāgāras, eighty-four thousand thrones made of the seven precious substances were arranged.

original: sarvatra cāsane tathāgato niṣaṇṇo dharman deśayati / / atha khalv ayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampitaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca āsane tathāgataḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ dharman deśayati atha khalu ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram prakampitaḥ
translated: And on every throne, a Tathāgata was seated, teaching the Dharma. Then this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisatvo mahāsatvo /
analyzed: sasūc
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra,

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya
translated: Having bowed to the Blessed One with joined palms,

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: he said this to the Blessed One:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yad imāny evaṃrūpāṇi rājagṛhe mahānagare prātihāryāṇi sandṛśyante /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat imāni evaṃrūpāṇi rājagṛhe mahā nagare prātihāryāṇi sandṛśyante
translated: What, Blessed One, is the cause, what is the condition, that such miracles are being seen in the great city of Rājagṛha?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: tat yathā kaścid eva puruṣaḥ syāt
translated: It is just as if there were a certain man

analyzed: cañcalaḥ
translated: who was fickle,

analyzed: capalo
translated: haughty,

analyzed: haṃkāra mamakāra sthitaḥ
translated: dwelling in the conceit of 'I' and 'mine,'

original: sa ca daridro bhavet / / tasya rājā śīrṣaṃ parimārjayed /
analyzed: sa ca daridraḥ bhavet tasya rājā śīrṣam parimārjayet
translated: and who was poor. The king would wipe his head with him.

analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ dhimānāt
translated: Then that man, out of excessive pride,

analyzed: yāvāt rājadvāram gatvā
translated: having gone to the king's gate,

original: balasā taṃ rājakulaṃ praveṣṭum icched / atha te rājāmātyapārṣadyās taṃ puruṣaṃ gṛhṇīyur /
analyzed: balasā tam rājakulam praveṣṭum icchet atha te rāja amātya pārṣadyāḥ tam puruṣam gṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: would wish to enter the royal palace by force. Then those royal ministers and attendants would seize that man,

analyzed: bahubhiḥ ca prakāraiḥ tāḍayeyuḥ
translated: and would beat him with many kinds of implements.

original: SaSūC / atha tena kālena tena samayena sa rājā śṛṇuyād etāṃ prakṛtiṃ /
analyzed: sasūc    atha tena kālena tena samayena sa rājā śṛṇuyāt etām prakṛtim
translated: Then at that time and on that occasion, that king would hear of this situation.

original: sa daridrapuruṣo balasābhyantaraṃ praveṣṭukāma / iti śrutvā cāsyaivaṃ bhaved /
analyzed: sa daridra puruṣaḥ balasābhyantaram praveṣṭu kāmaḥ iti śrutvā ca asya evam bhavet
translated: 'That poor man wishes to enter by force.' Having heard this, he would think thus:

original: avaśyam ayaṃ mama ghātayitukāmaḥ / / tataḥ sa rājā ruṣṭas tān pārṣadyān evaṃ vaded /
analyzed: avaśyam ayam mama ghātayitu kāmaḥ tatas sa rājā ruṣṭaḥ tān pārṣadyān evam vadet
translated: Then the king, angry, would say to those courtiers:

analyzed: gacchantu bhavanta
translated: 'Go, sirs.

original: etaṃ puruṣaṃ parvatavivaraṃ nītvā jīvitād vyaparopayatha sarvaparivāraṃ /
analyzed: etam puruṣam parvata vivaram nītvā jīvitāt vyaparopayatha sarva parivāram
translated: Take this man to a mountain cave and deprive him of life, along with his entire family.

original: mātāpitṛputraduhitṛdāsīdāsakarmakarāṇāṃ ca vyasanam āpādayatha / / atha te sarve jīvitād vyavaropitāḥ /
analyzed: mātā pitṛ putra duhitṛ dāsī dāsa karmakarāṇām ca vyasanam āpādayatha atha te sarve jīvitāt vyavaropitāḥ
translated: Bring misfortune upon his parents, children, daughters, female slaves, male slaves, and workers.' Then they would all be deprived of life.

original: tasya ca sarve svajanabandhuvargāḥ paramaśokaśalyasamarpitā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca sarve sva jana bandhu vargāḥ parama śoka śalya samarpitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all his relatives and kinsmen would be filled with the utmost grief and pain.

original: SaSūC / evam eva sarvaśūra tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ satvānān dharman deśayati / / tatra /
analyzed: sasūc    evam eva sarvaśūra tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ satvānān dharman deśayati tatra
translated: Thus, Sarvaśūra, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, teaches the Dharma to beings.🔽There,

analyzed: yathā sa puruṣaḥ dhimānika
translated: just as that conceited man,

analyzed: evam bāla pṛthagjanāḥ
translated: so are the foolish ordinary people.

analyzed: tathāgatam rūpa varṇa liṃga saṃsthānataḥ nimittam udgṛhya
translated: Grasping at the Tathāgata in terms of form, color, characteristics, and appearance,

analyzed: tathāgata kāyam iti saṃjānanti
translated: they think, 'This is the Tathāgata's body.'

original: SaSūC / tatra te bahūn dharmāṃ cchrutvādhimāne patanti /
analyzed: sasūc   tatra te bahūn dharmān śrutvā adhimāne patanti
translated: There, having heard many teachings, they fall into conceit.

original: nānāpralāpān pralapanti / / ahaṃkāramamakāreṇābhibhūtāḥ svayam eva dharmaṃ na śṛṇvanti na prakāśayanti / / yaḥ kaścit sūtraṃ vā gāthāṃ vāntaśo
analyzed: nānā pralāpān pralapanti ahaṃkāra mamakāreṇa abhibhūtāḥ svayam eva dharmam na śṛṇvanti na prakāśayanti  yaḥ kaścid sūtram vā gāthām vā antaśas
translated: Whoever teaches them a sūtra or verse, or even

analyzed: dṛṣṭāntam vā teṣām ārocayati
translated: a parable,

analyzed: tat te na gṛhṇanti
translated: they do not accept it.

analyzed: na śrotram avadadhanti
translated: They do not lend an ear.

analyzed: vayam svayam jānīmahe iti
translated: We know for ourselves.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: yathā apinama adhimāna tvāt tena bāhuśrutyena pramādam āpadyante
translated: Because of their conceit, they fall into negligence through that great learning.

original: SaSūC / ye bālapṛthagjanaiḥ sārdhaṃ samavadhānaṃ kurvanti na te tathārūpaṃ dharmopasaṃhitaṃ vacanaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: sa sūc   ye bāla pṛthagjanaiḥ sārdham samavadhānam kurvanti na te tathārūpam dharma upasaṃhitam vacanam śroṣyanti
translated: Those who associate with foolish ordinary people will not hear such Dharma-related speech.

analyzed: te tena bāhuśrutyena pramattāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be negligent through that great learning.

analyzed: te tathārūpāḥ puruṣāḥ sva kāvyāni sthāpayanti
translated: Those people will establish their own compositions.

analyzed: svakāni granthā nidānāni sthāpayanti
translated: They will establish their own texts and sources.

analyzed: te sarva lokam ca ātmānam ca visaṃpādayanti
translated: They will deceive the whole world and themselves.

analyzed: vyartham ca rāṣṭra piṇḍam prabhūtam paribhokṣyanti
translated: They will consume the country's alms in vain.

original: bhuktvā ca na samyak pariṇamayiṣyanti / / maraṇakālasamaye teṣāṃ mahāsantrāso bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhuktvā ca na samyak pariṇamayiṣyanti maraṇa kāla samaye teṣām mahā santrāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: At the time of death, they will have great fear.

original: SaSūC / te ca satvās taṃ vakṣyanti /
analyzed: sasūc   te ca satvāḥ tam vakṣyanti
translated: And those beings will say to him:

original: bahavas tvayā vayaṃ śilpajñānaṃ śikṣāpitāḥ kathaṃ tvaṃ svam ātmānaṃ na śaknuṣe saṃsthāpayituṃ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ tvayā vayam śilpa jñānam śikṣāpitāḥ katham tvam svam ātmānam na śaknuṣe saṃsthāpayitum
translated: 'You have taught us the knowledge of many crafts. Why can you not now maintain yourself?'

analyzed: sa teṣām evam vadet
translated: He will say to them:

original: na śakyaṃ mārṣā idānīm ātmānaṃ parisaṃsthāpayituṃ /
analyzed: na śakyam mārṣāḥ idānīm ātmānam parisaṃsthāpayitum
translated: 'Friends, it is not possible now to maintain myself.'

analyzed: sasūc tatra te satvāḥ
translated: And those beings,

analyzed: tasya tat bhāṣitam śrutvā
translated: having heard his words,🔽will lament in various ways.

original: nānāprakāraṃ paridevayiṣyanti / / yathā tasyaikapudgalasyārthena bahavo jñātisaṃghā jīvitād vyavaropitā anaparādhinaḥ /
analyzed: nānā prakāram paridevayiṣyanti yathā tasya eka pudgalasya arthena bahavaḥ jñāti saṃghāḥ jīvitāt vyavaropitāḥ anaparādhinaḥ
translated: Just as for the sake of that one person, many kinsmen were deprived of life, innocent,

analyzed: sva karma pratyayena
translated: by the power of their own karma,

analyzed: evam eva te satvāḥ maraṇa kāla samaye
translated: in the same way, at the time of death,

analyzed: teṣām paridevatām naraka tiryagyoni parāyaṇam ātmānam samanupaśyante kalyāṇa mitra saṃsarga hetoḥ
translated: those beings, lamenting, will see themselves destined for the hells, animal wombs, and the realm of hungry ghosts, due to association with an evil friend.

original: tad ahaṃ yuṣmākaṃ brāhmaṇānām anyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthānām evaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: tat aham yuṣmākam brāhmaṇānām anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthānām evam vadāmi
translated: Therefore, Brahmins, I say this to you and to others of different faiths, wandering mendicants, and Jain ascetics:

analyzed: mā yūyam pramattāḥ bhavatha
translated: Do not be heedless.

original: tadyathāpināmājātapakṣaḥ śakunir na śaknoty ākāśe prakramituṃ devalokagamanāya /
analyzed: tat yathā apināmā ajāta pakṣaḥ śakuniḥ na śaknoti ākāśe prakramitum deva loka gamanāya
translated: Just as a bird with undeveloped wings is unable to soar in the sky to go to the world of the gods,

original: evam eva yuṣmābhir ahaṃkāramamakārasthitair na śakyaṃ nirvāṇaṃ anuprāptuṃ /
analyzed: evam eva yuṣmābhiḥ ahaṃkāra mamakāra sthitaiḥ na śakyam nirvāṇam anuprāptum
translated: in the same way, you who abide in the conceit of 'I' and 'mine' are unable to attain nirvana.

original: na yuṣmākaṃ tathā ṛddhiḥ saṃvidyate / / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na yuṣmākam tathā ṛddhiḥ saṃvidyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: You do not have such spiritual power. Why is that?🔽You have been born in the womb of a hen, as it were, by the topic of karma. Before long, this body, which has the nature of breaking apart, will end in death.

original: karmaprakaraṇena yūyaṃ kukkuṭayonyā ivotpannāḥ / / na cireṇāyaṃ kāyo bhedanadharmā maraṇaparyavasāno bhaviṣyati / / maraṇakālasamaye nirāsvādanatā /
analyzed: karma prakaraṇena yūyam kukkuṭa yonyāḥ iva utpannāḥ na cireṇa ayam kāyaḥ bhedana dharmā maraṇa paryavasānaḥ bhaviṣyati maraṇa kāla samaye nirāsvādana tā
translated: At the time of death, there will be no enjoyment.

analyzed: paritasyana tā ca bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be anxiety.

original: SaSūC / kim ayam asmābhir ātmabhāvaḥ sandhārito ye vayaṃ na devasukhaṃ na pratyanubhaviṣyāma /
analyzed: sasūc    kim ayam asmābhiḥ ātmabhāvaḥ sandhāritaḥ ye vayam na deva sukham na pratyanubhaviṣyāma
translated: What is the use of this body that we have sustained, since we will not experience the bliss of the gods,

analyzed: na api nirvāṇa pada sthāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ
translated: nor will we attain the state of nirvana?

original: nirarthakam asmābhiḥ śarīram udvūḍhaṃ/🔽kā gatir asmābhiḥ kiṃ parāyaṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽kutropapattiḥ /
analyzed: nirarthakam asmābhiḥ śarīram udvūḍham  kā gatiḥ asmābhiḥ kim parāyaṇam bhaviṣyati  kutra upapattiḥ
translated: Our body has been raised in vain.🔽What will be our destination? What will be our refuge?🔽Where will we be reborn?

analyzed: kutra vā nirodhaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Where will we cease to be?

original: SaSūC / atha khalu bhagavāṃ punar api tān anyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthabrāhmaṇān āmantrayati /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu bhagavān punar api tān anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇān āmantrayati
translated: Sūtra: Then the Blessed One again addressed those non-Buddhist ascetics, brāhmaṇas, and Jains:

original: mā yūyaṃ mārṣā ratnamayāj jaṃbudvīpān nirāśā bhaviṣyadhve/
analyzed: mā yūyam mārṣāḥ ratna mayāt jaṃbudvīpāt nirāśāḥ bhaviṣyadhve
translated: Do not, friends, be disappointed in the jewel-like Jambudvīpa.

analyzed: mā yūyam dharma ratnāt paribāhyāḥ bhaviṣyatha iti
translated: Do not be excluded from the jewel of the Dharma.

original: pṛcchatha yūyaṃ mārṣās tathāgataṃ yad yad evākāṃkṣathāha /
analyzed: pṛcchatha yūyam mārṣāḥ tathāgatam yat yat eva ākāṃkṣatha āha
translated: Friends, ask the Tathāgata whatever you wish.

analyzed: aham yuṣmākam sarva abhiprāyān paripūrayiṣyāmi
translated: I will fulfill all your intentions.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu te sarve brāhmaṇānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthā utthāyāsanebhya /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu te sarve utthāya āsanebhyaḥ
translated: Sūtra: Then all those brāhmaṇas, non-Buddhist ascetics, and Jains rose from their seats,

analyzed: eka aṃsāni cīvarāṇi pravṛtya
translated: arranged their upper robes over one shoulder,

analyzed: aṃjalayaḥ pragṛhya
translated: joined their palms,

analyzed: bhagavantam paripṛcchanti sma
translated: and asked the Blessed One:

original: bahūni bhagavaṃ satvāni rātrindivas tathāgataḥ saṃsārāt parimocayati /
analyzed: bahūni bhagavan satvāni rātrindivaḥ tathāgataḥ saṃsārāt parimocayati
translated: Blessed One, many beings are liberated from saṃsāra by the Tathāgata day and night.

original: na ca satvadhātor ūnatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā prajñāyate / / ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat te satvā samānā utpādanirodhaṃ darśayanti /
analyzed: na ca satva dhātoḥ ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā prajñāyate kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat te satvāḥ samānāḥ utpāda nirodham darśayanti
translated: Yet no decrease or fullness of the realm of beings is perceived. What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, that those beings, being the same, show arising and cessation?

original: SaSūC / atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisatvaṃ mahāsatvam āmantrayati sma /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisatvam mahāsatvam āmantrayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpūra:

analyzed: mahā sannāham sannahyanti tīrthyāḥ mahā kaukṛtya vinodana arthāya mahā dharma ulkā jvālanāya mahā praśna nidānam
translated: The tīrthikas put on the great armor in order to dispel great remorse, to light the great torch of the Dharma, and to ask the great question.

original: paripṛcchanti / / paścime tu kāle na bhaviṣyanti daharā satvā vṛddhā vā ye utpādanirodhaṃ
analyzed: paripṛcchanti paścime tu kāle na bhaviṣyanti satvāḥ vṛddhāḥ vā ye utpāda nirodham
translated: In the later times, there will be no young or old beings who will bring about cessation.

original: kariṣyanti / santi bhaiṣajyasena vṛddhā satvā daharā iva na kiṃcij jānanti /
analyzed: kariṣyanti santi bhaiṣajyasena vṛddhā satvāḥ daharāḥ iva na kiṃcid jānanti
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpūra, there are old beings who know nothing like young ones.

original: SaSūC / tadyathāpināma bhaiṣajyasena kaścid eva puruṣaḥ śiraḥ śocayeta /

analyzed: purāṇakāni ca vastrāṇi prāvṛṇuyāt

analyzed: tāni ca śithilakāni bhavanti

analyzed: vastram ca asya na śobhate  evam eva bhaiṣajyasena saṃti vṛddhā satvāḥ ye jaṃbudvīpam na śobhayanti daharāḥ tu satvāḥ utpāda nirodham darśayanti

original: SaSūC / atha khalu te sarve 'nyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthabrāhmaṇā utthāyāsanād /
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu te sarve nyatīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇāḥ utthāya āsanāt
translated: Then all those non-Buddhist practitioners, mendicants, and brahmins rose from their seats,

analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan asmākam vṛddhaḥ vā daharaḥ vā

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: vṛddhāḥ yūyam

original: punaḥ punar narakatiryakpreteṣu duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ dṛṣṭvā tad adyāpi yūyaṃ tṛptiṃ nādhigacchatha/
analyzed: punar punar naraka tiryak preteṣu duḥkhām vedanām dṛṣṭvā tat adya api yūyam tṛptim na adhigacchatha
translated: Having seen suffering again and again in the hells, as animals, and as ghosts, you still have not attained satisfaction.

analyzed: sasūc   atha khalu te sarve brāhmaṇa anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthāḥ
translated: Then all those brahmins, non-Buddhist practitioners, mendicants, and Jain ascetics,

translated: and all the nāga kings said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: te ca anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇāḥ evam āhuḥ

analyzed: sāṃpratam tathāgataḥ sarva loka pratyakṣam karoti

original: SaSūC / atha khalu caturnavati koṭīsahasrāṇi navakānāṃ satvānāṃ te tathāgatasya purataḥ sthitāḥ / na ca tathāgataṃ vandanti /

analyzed: bahūni ca kṣetra ārāmāṇi saṃvidyeran

analyzed: atha rājā tayoḥ evam āha

analyzed: puṣpāṇi

analyzed: phalāni ca prādurbhūtāni

analyzed: puṣpāṇi

analyzed: rājā āha

analyzed: bhagavān āha

analyzed: katame vṛddhāḥ
translated: and which are the old?

analyzed: āha ye te vṛkṣebhyaḥ nirjātāḥ
translated: He said, Those that are born from trees,

analyzed: te daharāḥ āha
translated: they are the young ones. He said,

analyzed: icchāmi bhagavan daharāṇi satvāni draṣṭum

original: SaSūC / atha khalu sa bhagavāṃś candrāvatikṣetras tathāgato dakṣiṇaṃ pāṇitalaṃ prasārayati / / atha daśabhyo digbhyaḥ koṭīśatasahasraṃ
analyzed: sasūc    atha khalu sa bhagavān candrāvatikṣetraḥ tathāgataḥ dakṣiṇam pāṇi talam prasārayati atha daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ koṭī śata sahasram
translated: Then that Blessed One, the Tathagata of the Candravati field, extended his right palm, and then from the ten directions, a hundred thousand kotis

analyzed: jana kāyānām āgacchanti

analyzed: diśi paṃcāśat koṭī jana kāyasya āgacchanti

analyzed: na ca tathāgatam ālapanti

analyzed: tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsayanti sma

analyzed: tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsayanti

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: na jānāsi bhaiṣajyasena

analyzed: acetanaḥ pṛthivī pradeśe na ālapanti

analyzed: na saṃlapanti
translated: they do not converse,

original: na dharmaskandhaṃ prajānāti / / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na dharma skandham prajānāti tat kasya hetoḥ

analyzed: na nirodham jānanti

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca na jarām

analyzed: na vyādhim

analyzed: na śokam  na paridevam

analyzed: na priya viprayogam  na apriya saṃprayogam

analyzed: na priyāt vinābhāvam

analyzed: na maraṇam

analyzed: punar punar te bhaiṣajyasena śikṣayitavyāḥ

analyzed: kutas cyavanti

analyzed: kutra upapadyante ye dharmam na jānanti

analyzed: na cīmarakāreṇa kṛtam

analyzed: na kāṣṭhakāreṇa kṛtam
translated: Not made by a woodworker.🔽Not made by a potter. They do not arise out of fear of the king.

analyzed: teṣām pūrva kṛtānām pāpakānām karmaṇām vipākam

translated: Here itself, Bhaisajyasena, those young beings who have come but do not speak,

analyzed: na saṃlapanti
translated: who do not converse,

analyzed: na uttiṣṭhanti te īdṛśān duḥkhām vedanām anubhavanti

analyzed: anena kāraṇena bhaiṣajyasena na ālapanti

original: na saṃlapanti / / evaṃ te bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ satvāḥ /

analyzed: kuśalam a jānānāḥ
translated: not knowing what is wholesome,

analyzed: na utpādam jānanti

analyzed: na nirodham jānanti
translated: do not know cessation,

analyzed: na ca te mānuṣyakam ātma bhāvam pratilapsyante ime ucyante bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ satvāḥ

original: SaSūC / āha / kathaṃ bhagavan daharāḥ satvā utpadyante /

analyzed: katham nirudhyante
translated: How do they cease?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Bhagavān said,

analyzed: kaḥ tra abhijātaḥ jātaḥ

analyzed: kaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Who has attained parinirvāṇa?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Bhagavān said,

analyzed: buddhaḥ eva bhaiṣajyasena abhijātaḥ jātaḥ

analyzed: tathāgataḥ eva parinirvṛtaḥ

analyzed: cintayet naṣṭaḥ eṣa puruṣaḥ

analyzed: tam agni raśmim paśyet
translated: would see that ray of fire.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca āśvastaḥ bhavet
translated: And having seen it, he would be comforted.

original: utsāhaṃ ca vardhayet / / sa cāgniḥ kenacid eva hetunā prajvaleta /

analyzed: tasya evam bhavet

analyzed: mā uttrasatha

analyzed: abhayam yuṣmākam bhavatu

analyzed: bandhana avarodham vā bhaviṣyati
translated: or imprisonment.🔽And I will not destroy the life of any being.

analyzed: sarva vyādhi praśāntaḥ yathā sa puruṣaḥ gṛha dāhāt sva kāyam dahati
translated: Just as that man, because of the burning of his house, burns his own body,

analyzed: evam eva tathāgataḥ

analyzed: vṛddhān ca satvān mocayati
translated: and old beings.

analyzed: buddhakṣetram jina kṣetram praśastam jina śāsanam

analyzed: śāstā karoti upāyam hi sarva satva parigrahe

analyzed: sthitaḥ nirvāṇa dhātau sandṛśyate dharaṇī tale

analyzed: mocayitvā ānupūrveṇa sarva satvān tri dhātukāt

analyzed: baddhāḥ hi naraka dvāraḥ tiryak pretāḥ vimocitāḥ

analyzed: sādhu dharma guṇaḥ kṣetram saṃgha sāmagri darśanam

analyzed: sādhu saṃghāta nirdeśam sarva pāpa vināśanam
translated: Good is the teaching of the unity, the destruction of all evil,

analyzed: ye śroṣyanti idam sūtram padam prāpsyanti anuttaram
translated: Those who will hear this sutra will attain the unsurpassed state.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: paśyasi tvam kula putra etāni daharāṇi satvāni

analyzed: āha paśyāmi bhagavan

analyzed: paśyāmi sugata bhagavān āha
translated: I see, Well-Gone. The Blessed One said:
