translated: And have you not seen the people of Jambudvīpa giving gifts,

analyzed: puṇyāni ca kurvantaḥ upavāsam upavasantaḥ
translated: making merit, observing the uposatha,

analyzed: tathāgata kṣetre kuśala mūla bījāni avaropayantaḥ
translated: planting the seeds of wholesome roots in the Tathāgata's field,🔽incense, garlands,

analyzed: gandham vā mālyam vā 🔽dīpam va
translated: lamps,

original: na tvayā dṛṣṭaṃ khādanīyabhojanīyaṃ vā dīyamānam /
analyzed: na tvayā dṛṣṭam khādanīya bhojanīyam vā dīyamānam
translated: You have never seen food or drink being given.

original: na ca te dṛṣṭās tathāgatasya catasraḥ parṣadaḥ santarpyamānāḥ /🔽bhikṣur vā / bhikṣuṇī vā /🔽upāsako vā /
analyzed: na ca te dṛṣṭāḥ tathāgatasya catasraḥ parṣadaḥ santarpyamānāḥ  bhikṣuḥ vā bhikṣuṇī vā  upāsakaḥ vā
translated: You have never seen the four assemblies of the Tathāgata being satisfied.🔽A monk or a nun.

analyzed: upāsikā vā
translated: A male lay follower or a female lay follower.

analyzed: imāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ śāsane bhinivustāḥ
translated: These four assemblies are devoted to the teaching.

analyzed: evam tasya hitāni vadanti
translated: Thus they speak for his benefit.

original: ālapanti ca / / na hi devakṛtaṃ kiṃcit /
analyzed: ālapanti ca na hi deva kṛtam kiṃcid
translated: And they address him. There is nothing done by a god.

original: asādhu tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa kṛtam imaṃ jaṃbudvīpam āgatya /
analyzed: asādhu tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa kṛtam imam jaṃbudvīpam āgatya
translated: Alas, you have done badly, O man, having come to this Jambudvīpa.

analyzed: sasūc    tasya mṛtasya dharmarājā
translated: The Dharma King of that dead one.

analyzed: tasmin kāle tam puruṣam anuśāsan
translated: At that time, instructing that man.

analyzed: tāḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣate
translated: He spoke these verses.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tathāgata utpādam śrutvā gaṇḍī parāhatām
translated: Having seen the Tathāgata's appearance, having heard the Gandī struck,

analyzed: śrutvā dharman deśayamānam śantam nirvāṇa gāminam
translated: Having heard him teaching the Dharma, peaceful, leading to Nirvāṇa.

original: kasmāt te na kṛtaṃ puṇyaṃ paralokasukhāvaham /
analyzed: kasmāt te na kṛtam puṇyam para loka sukha āvaham
translated: Why have you not made merit that brings happiness in the next world?

analyzed: bhokṣyase narake duḥkham aniṣṭa karmaṇaḥ phalam
translated: You will experience the suffering of hell, the result of unpleasant actions.

original: SaSūC / atha sa puruṣas taṃ dharmarājānaṃ gāthābhir pratyabhāṣata /
analyzed: sasūc    atha sa puruṣaḥ tam dharmarājānam gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣata
translated: Then that man replied to the Dharma King with verses:

analyzed: bāla buddhiḥ aham āsam pāpa mitra vaśa anugaḥ
translated: I was foolish, following evil friends.

original: kṛtaṃ me pāpakaṃ karma kāmabhrāntena cetasā //
analyzed: kṛtam me pāpakam karma kāma bhrāntena cetasā
translated: I have committed evil actions, with a mind deluded by desire.

original: kāmaś ca me citas tasya āgataṃ dāruṇaṃ phalam /
analyzed: kāmaḥ ca me citaḥ tasya āgatam dāruṇam phalam
translated: And for that desire of mine, terrible fruits have come.

original: kṛtā me prāṇināṃ hiṃsā sāṃghikaṃ ca vināśitaṃ //
analyzed: kṛtā me prāṇinām hiṃsā sāṃghikam ca vināśitam
translated: I have harmed living beings, and destroyed the Saṅgha.

original: kṛtaṃ me stūpabhedaṃ ca praduṣṭena ca cetasā /
analyzed: kṛtam me stūpa bhedam ca praduṣṭena ca cetasā
translated: I have broken into stūpas, with a corrupted mind.

original: dauṣṭhulyaṃ bhāṣitaṃ vākyaṃ mātā me paritāpitā //
analyzed: dauṣṭhulyam bhāṣitam vākyam mātā me paritāpitā
translated: Harsh words have been spoken, and my mother has been tormented.

analyzed: aparādham vijānāmi sva śarīreṇa yat kṛtam
translated: I acknowledge the offense, what has been done with my own body.

analyzed: raurave narake paśyāmi upapattim su dāruṇe
translated: I see rebirth in the terrible Raurava hell.

original: saṃghāte vedanāṃ vetsye tathaiva ca pratāpane /🔽mahāvīcau ca kaṭukām anubhaviṣyāmi vedanāṃ //
analyzed: saṃghāte vedanām vetsye tathā eva ca pratāpane  mahāvīcau ca kaṭukām anubhaviṣyāmi vedanām
translated: I will experience pain in Saṃghāta, and likewise in Tapana.🔽I will experience bitter pain in Mahāvīci.

analyzed: mahāpadme ca narake krandayiṣyāmi su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: And in the great lotus hell, I will cry out in great suffering.

analyzed: śatam kālasūtre utpatsyāmi mahā bhaye
translated: For a hundred years, I will be reborn in the great fear of Kālasūtra.

original: hatāś ca nārakā satvāḥ punaḥ paśyanti te bhayam /
analyzed: hatāḥ ca satvāḥ punar paśyanti te bhayam
translated: The beings in hell, once killed, see that fear again.

analyzed: yojanānām śatam bhūyas prapadyanti mahā bhayam
translated: Again, for a hundred yojanas, they enter great fear.

original: dvāran te na labhiṣyanti punaḥ kuṃbhe prapāpitāḥ /
analyzed: dvāran te na labhiṣyanti punar kuṃbhe prapāpitāḥ
translated: They will not find a door, again thrown into the pot.

original: kṣūraṃ tu nāma narakaṃ sahasraṃ kṣūrasaṃbhavam //
analyzed: kṣūram tu nāma narakam sahasram kṣūra saṃbhavam
translated: The hell named Kṣūra is a thousand times worse than that.

analyzed: śatam sahasram koṭīnām kṣūrāṇām jāyate gratas
translated: A hundred thousand koṭis of razors are born in front of him.

original: tais tasya bhidyate gātraṃ karmabhi duṣkṛtaiḥ svakaiḥ //
analyzed: taiḥ tasya bhidyate gātram karmabhiḥ duṣkṛtaiḥ svakaiḥ
translated: By his own evil deeds, his body is cut by them.

original: vātakṣobhā mahāghorā sarvaṃ chindanti tāṃ tanum /
analyzed: vāta kṣobhā mahā ghorā sarvam chindanti tām tanum
translated: The extremely terrible wind-disturbances cut off that entire body.

original: anubhāvyā mayā duḥkhā īdṛśā narake dhruvam //
analyzed: anubhāvyāḥ mayā duḥkhāḥ īdṛśāḥ narake dhruvam
translated: Such sufferings are certainly to be experienced by me in hell.

analyzed: drakṣyante sarva satvāḥ me kāyam duḥkha prapīḍitam
translated: All beings will see my body afflicted with pain.

original: arthā parakyā ādattā mayā veśmasya kāraṇāt //🔽putrā duhitaro mahyaṃ bhrātā ca bhaginī tathā /
analyzed: arthā parakyā ādattā mayā veśmasya kāraṇāt  putrāḥ duhitaraḥ mahyam bhrātā ca bhaginī tathā
translated: For the sake of a house, I have taken others' wealth.🔽My sons, daughters, brother, sister,

original: mātā pitā caiva mama mitrajñātigaṇo 'pi ca //
analyzed: mātā pitā ca eva mama mitra jñāti gaṇaḥ ca
translated: my mother, father, and also my host of friends and relatives,

original: dāsakarmakarāś caiva gāvo bhṛtyaḥ paśuṃ tathā /🔽bhrānto 'smy ahaṃ kukāryeṣu rupyasauvarṇabhājanaiḥ //
analyzed: dāsa karmakarāḥ ca eva gāvaḥ bhṛtyaḥ paśum tathā  bhrāntaḥ smi aham ku kāryeṣu rupya sauvarṇa bhājanaiḥ
translated: slaves, workers, cows, servants, and animals,🔽I have wandered in bad deeds, with silver and golden vessels.

original: vastrais tathā susūkṣmaiś ca bhrāntaḥ kārāpane gṛhe /
analyzed: vastraiḥ tathā su sūkṣmaiḥ ca bhrāntaḥ kārāpane gṛhe
translated: And with very fine clothes, I have wandered in the house, causing trouble.

analyzed: su vicitram gṛham kṛtvā nara nārī samākulam
translated: Having made a very colorful house full of men and women,

original: vīṇās tūryāḥ parāhatya rataṃ me durdamaṃ manaḥ /
analyzed: vīṇāḥ tūryāḥ parāhatya ratam me durdamam manaḥ
translated: having played vīṇās and musical instruments, my mind has been indulged in sex.

original: gātraṃ gandhodakair liptaṃ kṛtajño 'dyāpi naiva saḥ //
analyzed: gātram gandha udakaiḥ liptam kṛtajñaḥ na eva saḥ
translated: Even today, he is not grateful, his body smeared with fragrant water.

analyzed: acetana śarīraḥ tvam bhrāntaḥ smi tava kāraṇāt
translated: You have an insentient body, I am deluded because of you.

original: na vidyate mama trātā kaścit satvaḥ punar bhavet //
analyzed: na vidyate mama trātā kaścid satvaḥ punar bhavet
translated: I have no protector, but some being may come again.

original: vātakṣobhe mahāghore śarīraparitāpane /🔽bhuktā rasā svāduvanto jihvayā vividhās tathā //
analyzed: vāta kṣobhe mahā ghore śarīra paritāpane  bhuktāḥ svāduvantaḥ jihvayā vividhāḥ tathā
translated: In the great and terrible disturbance of the wind, which torments the body,🔽Various tastes have been enjoyed with the tongue, and so on.

original: śīrṣe mālāś ca bahavo baddhā śvitrāḥ suśobhanāḥ /
analyzed: śīrṣe mālāḥ ca bahavaḥ baddhā śvitrāḥ su śobhanāḥ
translated: Many garlands have been bound on the head, white and very beautiful.

original: rūpeṇa bhrāmitaś cakṣuś cakṣutrāṇaṃ na vidyate //
analyzed: rūpeṇa bhrāmitaḥ cakṣuḥ cakṣu trāṇam na vidyate
translated: The eye is deluded by form, there is no protection for the eye.

original: pāpānāṃ cakṣuṣī hetur mayā dṛṣṭvā tu yat kṛtam /
analyzed: pāpānām cakṣuṣī hetuḥ mayā dṛṣṭvā tu yat kṛtam
translated: The eyes are the cause of sins, having seen what has been done by me.

original: śrotrau hetuś ca me bhūyaḥ bāhū vajraparāhatau //🔽hastebhyaḥ kaṭakā baddhā aṅgulīyebhi yaṃtrikā /
analyzed: śrotrau hetuḥ ca me bhūyas bāhū vajra parāhatau  hastebhyaḥ kaṭakā baddhā aṅgulīyebhiḥ yaṃtrikā
translated: The ears are the cause for me again, the arms are struck by the thunderbolt.🔽On the hands bracelets are bound, on the fingers rings.

analyzed: grīvāyām mukti hārāṇi pādau ca api su alaṃkṛtau
translated: On the neck necklaces, and the feet are also well-adorned.

original: jālāni kṛtvā tatraiva sauvaraṇaṃ saṃsthitaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: jālāni kṛtvā tatra eva sauvaraṇam saṃsthitam tatas
translated: Having made nets there, gold is placed there.

original: gātrai ca vividhā ratnā sauvarṇakaṭakās tathā //
analyzed: ca vividhā ratnā sauvarṇa kaṭakāḥ tathā
translated: And various jewels on the body, and golden bracelets.

analyzed: udāraiḥ ramitaḥ bhogaiḥ mana saṃbṛhaṇaiḥ api
translated: Having enjoyed with extensive pleasures, which also delight the mind,

original: sparśaṃ ca sukumāraṃ me tṛṣṇagrastena sevitaṃ //
analyzed: sparśam ca su kumāram me tṛṣṇa grastena sevitam
translated: I enjoyed tender touch, being seized by craving.

original: nānāstaraṇaśayyābhiḥ kāyaḥ krīḍāpito mayā /🔽snāto gandhodakair viśadair gandhaiś cāpi pralepitaḥ //
analyzed: nānā āstaraṇa śayyābhiḥ kāyaḥ krīḍāpitaḥ mayā  snātaḥ gandha udakaiḥ viśadaiḥ gandhaiḥ ca api pralepitaḥ
translated: My body was entertained with various bedding and seats.🔽I bathed with clear scented water and was anointed with perfumes.

analyzed: karpūra candanaiḥ divyaiḥ dhūpanaiḥ ca api dhūpitaḥ
translated: I was fumigated with divine camphor, sandalwood, and incense.

original: kastūrikāsamāyukto vāso varṇakaraḥ kṛtaḥ //🔽gandhavārṣikatailena sumanācaṃpakādibhiḥ /🔽mrakṣitaḥ pāṇḍuraṃ vastraṃ prāvṛtaṃ sūkṣmakāśikam //
analyzed: kastūrikā samāyuktaḥ vāsaḥ varṇa karaḥ kṛtaḥ                 mrakṣitaḥ pāṇḍuram vastram prāvṛtam sūkṣma kāśikam
translated: I wore clothes dyed with musk, which gave color.🔽I was anointed with fragrant monsoon oil, with jasmine, champak, and other flowers.🔽I wore a white, fine silk garment.

analyzed: avatīrya hasti pṛṣṭhāt aśva pṛṣṭhe abhiruhya ca
translated: Having descended from the elephant's back, I mounted the horse's back.

original: rājāham iti manyāmi jano me dhāvate grataḥ //
analyzed: rājā aham iti manyāmi janaḥ me dhāvate gratas
translated: Thinking 'I am the king,' people ran in front of me.

analyzed: antaḥpuram vijānāmi gīte nṛtye su śīkṣitaḥ
translated: I knew the inner quarters, well-trained in singing and dancing.

original: nirāparādhā mṛgayā hatāḥ kāṇḍaiś ca me mṛgāḥ //
analyzed: nirāparādhā mṛgayā hatāḥ kāṇḍaiḥ ca me mṛgāḥ
translated: Innocent deer were killed by me with arrows.

original: īdṛśaṃ me kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ paralokam ajānatā /
analyzed: īdṛśam me kṛtam pāpam para lokam a jānatā
translated: Such evil deeds were done by me, not knowing about the next world.

original: paramāṃsā mayā bhuktās tato duḥkham idaṃ mama //
analyzed: para māṃsāḥ mayā bhuktāḥ tatas duḥkham idam mama
translated: I ate the flesh of the highest beings, therefore this suffering is mine.

original: maraṇaṃ me na vijñātam āgamiṣyati dāruṇaṃ /
analyzed: maraṇam me na vijñātam āgamiṣyati dāruṇam
translated: I did not know that death would come, terrible.

original: bālabuddhir aham āsaṃ śarīraṃ poṣitaṃ mayā //
analyzed: bāla buddhiḥ aham āsam śarīram poṣitam mayā
translated: I had the mind of a child, I nourished my body.

original: āgataṃ maraṇaṃ me 'dya kaścit trātā na vidyate /
analyzed: āgatam maraṇam me dya kaścid trātā na vidyate
translated: Death has come upon me today. There is no savior to be found.

original: yūyaṃ hi jñātayaḥ sarve mukhaṃ me kiṃ nirīkṣatha //🔽kasmād vastraṃ pāṭayadhvaṃ pralāpaiś cāpi kiṃkṛte /🔽keśān kasmād vikiratha raktaṃ kiṃ vā kariṣyati //
analyzed: yūyam hi jñātayaḥ sarve mukham me kim nirīkṣatha  kasmāt vastram pāṭayadhvam pralāpaiḥ ca api kiṃkṛte  keśān kasmāt vikiratha raktam kim vā kariṣyati
translated: You are all my relatives. Why do you stare at my face?🔽Why do you tear at your clothes, and for what reason do you lament?🔽Why do you pull out your hair? What will blood do?

original: pāṃsuṃ ca śīrṣe kṣipatha urastāḍaṃ karotha kim /
analyzed: pāṃsum ca śīrṣe kṣipatha uraḥ tāḍam karotha kim
translated: Why do you throw dust on your head and beat your breasts?

original: jīvaṃ nāhaṃ vāritavyaḥ pāpāt kiṃ ruditena vaḥ //🔽śarīraṃ me vṛkabhojyaṃ kukkurāṇāṃ ca vāyasām /
analyzed: jīvam na aham vāritavyaḥ pāpāt kim ruditena vaḥ  śarīram me vṛka bhojyam kukkurāṇām ca vāyasām
translated: I am not to be stopped while alive. What is the use of weeping?🔽My body will be the food of wolves, dogs, and crows.

original: bhaviṣyate pakṣiṇāṃ ca vṛthāpuṣṭo mayā tanuḥ //
analyzed: bhaviṣyate pakṣiṇām ca vṛthā puṣṭaḥ mayā tanuḥ
translated: It will be for birds as well. My body has been uselessly nourished.

analyzed: maraṇa uraga saṃspṛṣṭaḥ jāyate su dāruṇaḥ
translated: One touched by the serpent of death becomes extremely terrible.

analyzed: tathā upayojyam bhaiṣajyam yathā asmāt mucyate bhayāt
translated: Medicines should be used in such a way as to be freed from fear.

original: yan me vaidyāḥ pradāsyanti bhaiṣajyaṃ na tad iṣyate /
analyzed: yat me vaidyāḥ pradāsyanti bhaiṣajyam na tat iṣyate
translated: The medicine that the physicians will give me is not desired.

analyzed: sāṃpratam dharma bhaiṣajyam kleśa uraga vimocakam
translated: Now, the medicine of Dharma, which liberates from the serpent of afflictions,

analyzed: mṛyataḥ mama dātavyam mām emam saṃprayacchatha
translated: should be given to me who is dying. Give this to me.

analyzed: puṣyamāṇa śarīraḥ yam avaśyam nāśam eṣyati
translated: This body, being nourished, will certainly perish.

original: pāpaskandhaṃ kim ākṣipya yat paścā duḥkhadāyakam /
analyzed: pāpa skandham kim ākṣipya yat paścā duḥkha dāyakam
translated: Having cast off a heap of sins which later bring suffering,

original: poṣito me pṛyaṃ kāyaḥ kṛtaghnatvaṃ kariṣyati //
analyzed: poṣitaḥ me kāyaḥ kṛtaghna tvam kariṣyati
translated: my beloved body that I have nourished will be ungrateful.

original: putrā duhitaraṃ kiṃ me cakṣuṣā sannirīkṣatha /
analyzed: putrāḥ duhitaram kim me cakṣuṣā san nirīkṣatha
translated: Why do you, my sons and daughters, look at me with eyes

original: trāyadhvam asmād rogān me rudadhvaṃ kin nirarthakam //
analyzed: trāyadhvam asmāt rogāt me rudadhvam kim nirarthakam
translated: save me from this disease, why do you weep in vain?

original: yūyaṃ hi putra duhitaḥ kṛtaghnā mama sāmpratam /
analyzed: yūyam hi putra duhitaḥ kṛtaghnāḥ mama sāmpratam
translated: You, my sons and daughters, are ungrateful to me now.

analyzed: yuṣmākam poṣaṇa arthāya parakīyam mayā hṛtam
translated: For the sake of nourishing you, I have taken what belongs to others.

original: sāṃprataṃ maraṇaṃ prāptaṃ nirāśaṃ māṃ karotha kim /
analyzed: sāṃpratam maraṇam prāptam nirāśam mām karotha kim
translated: Now that I have reached death, why do you make me hopeless?

analyzed: jāti durgati saṃtrastaḥ maraṇena ca pīḍitaḥ
translated: Afraid of birth and bad destinies, afflicted by death,

analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ sparśam parama vedanāḥ
translated: feeling, perception, mental formations, contact is the supreme feeling.

original: tṛṣṇāyā bhrāmyate bālaḥ prāpnoti kaṭukaṃ phalaṃ //
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ bhrāmyate bālaḥ prāpnoti kaṭukam phalam
translated: The fool wanders due to craving, and attains bitter fruits.

original: śokabandhanaṃ mahyaṃ tu jātasya viṣame kule /
analyzed: śoka bandhanam mahyam tu jātasya viṣame kule
translated: I am bound by sorrow, born in a family of misfortune.

original: alpapuṇyaṃ tu māṃ jñātvā śociṣyanty apare janāḥ //
analyzed: alpa puṇyam tu mām jñātvā śociṣyanti apare janāḥ
translated: Knowing that I have little merit, other people will grieve.

analyzed: dāna śīla paribhraṣṭaḥ dharmāt ca api parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: Fallen from generosity and morality, turned away from the Dharma,

analyzed: punarbhavam na jānīte kleśa uraga viṣa arditaḥ
translated: afflicted by the poison of the snake of afflictions, he does not know about rebirth.

original: bhrāmyate 'vidyayā bālo yatra mokṣaṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: bhrāmyate vidyayā bālaḥ yatra mokṣam na vidyate
translated: The fool wanders in ignorance where liberation is not found.

original: mokṣārthaṃ na vijānāti bhrāntaḥ pāpaṃ karoti ca //
analyzed: mokṣa artham na vijānāti bhrāntaḥ pāpam karoti ca
translated: Not knowing for the sake of liberation, he wanders and commits evil.

original: kleśaiś ca bhrāmyate bālo nityaṃ vyākṣiptamānasaḥ /
analyzed: kleśaiḥ ca bhrāmyate bālaḥ nityam vyākṣipta mānasaḥ
translated: The fool is confused by afflictions, his mind always distracted.

original: dahyate hy agninā dīptaḥ kāyo vividhabandhanaḥ //
analyzed: dahyate hi agninā dīptaḥ kāyaḥ vividha bandhanaḥ
translated: The body, burning with various bonds, is indeed burned by the blazing fire.

original: vibhrānto bhramate kāyo yatra saukhyaṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: vibhrāntaḥ bhramate kāyaḥ yatra saukhyam na vidyate
translated: The body, confused, wanders where there is no happiness.

original: tac ca saukhyaṃ na jānāti yad abhyantasukhāvaham //
analyzed: tat ca saukhyam na jānāti yat abhyanta sukha āvaham
translated: And he does not know that happiness which brings inner bliss.

analyzed: buddhānām sukha dam kṣetram dharmacakram mahāgadam
translated: The field of happiness of the Buddhas, the great medicine of the wheel of Dharma,

original: śīlaṃ ca satyaṃ śīlanāṃ brahmaghoṣās tathāgatā //
analyzed: śīlam ca satyam śīlanām brahmaghoṣāḥ tathāgatāḥ
translated: and morality, truth, and the Brahmic voice of the Tathagatas.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisatvaṃ mahāsatvam āmantreyad avocat /

analyzed: saṃsāre yena badhyāmaḥ paryantam a vijānakāḥ
translated: By which we are killed in saṃsāra, not knowing the end.

original: mārgan tu na vijānāmo mārgam eva na dṛśyate /
analyzed: mārgan tu na vijānāmaḥ mārgam eva na dṛśyate
translated: We do not know the path, the path itself is not seen.

original: andhabhūtā vayaṃ nātha asmākaṃ kuru saṃgrahaṃ //
analyzed: andha bhūtāḥ vayam nātha asmākam kuru saṃgraham
translated: We are like the blind, O Lord, have compassion on us.

original: adhyeṣāma vayaṃ vīra dharman deśaya nāyaka /
analyzed: adhyeṣāma vayam vīra dharman deśaya nāyaka
translated: We request you, O Hero, teach the Dharma, O Leader.

original: alpaprajñā vayaṃ jātā anabhijñāḥ sukhasya hi //
analyzed: alpa prajñāḥ vayam jātāḥ anabhijñāḥ sukhasya hi
translated: We have been born with little wisdom, ignorant of happiness.

original: dharman deśaya asmākaṃ duḥkhān mocaya dāruṇāt /
analyzed: dharman deśaya asmākam duḥkhāt mocaya dāruṇāt
translated: Teach the Dharma to us, liberate us from terrible suffering.

analyzed: yatra yatra upapadyema syāt asmāt buddha darśanam
translated: Wherever we are reborn, may we see the Buddha.

original: SaSūC / atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisatvo mahāsatvo /
analyzed: sasūc
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha

analyzed: yena te daharāḥ satvāḥ tena upasaṃkrānta
translated: approached those young beings.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya
translated: Having approached,

analyzed: etat avocat
translated: he said this:

original: bhūṃjadhvaṃ bhojanaṃ yūyaṃ pivadhvaṃ rasam adbhutam /
analyzed: bhūṃjadhvam bhojanam yūyam pivadhvam rasam adbhutam
translated: Eat food, you all, drink the wonderful juice.

original: paścād viśāradā bhūtvā dharmaṃ śroṣyatha nirbhayaṃ //
analyzed: paścāt viśāradāḥ bhūtvā dharmam śroṣyatha nirbhayam
translated: Then, having become fearless, you will listen to the Dharma without fear.

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:🔽We are hungry, O Sage, we are thirsty, O Great Hero.

original: bhadanta sthavira kas tvaṃ na jānīmo vayaṃ tava /
analyzed: bhadanta sthavira kaḥ tvam na jānīmaḥ vayam tava
translated: Venerable elder, who are you? We do not know you.

analyzed: prāsādikam tvām paśyāmaḥ śānta rūpam mahā yaśaḥ
translated: We see you as graceful, peaceful in form, of great fame.

analyzed: muktam naraka tiryakṣu preta lokāt mahā bhayāt
translated: You are freed from the great fears of the hells, animal realms, and the world of hungry ghosts.

original: śāntā te sarvapāpāni yathā jagati śobhase //
analyzed: śāntā te sarva pāpāni yathā jagati śobhase
translated: All your evil deeds are pacified, as you shine in the world.

analyzed: paśyāma haste karakam sapta ratna samanvitam
translated: We see a vessel in your hand, filled with the seven jewels,

analyzed: sūtram ratna āmayam kāye teja rāśau viveṣṭitam
translated: A jeweled thread wrapped around your body, a mass of radiance.

original: prativoḍhuṃ na śaktā smaḥ śāntavākyasya te vacaḥ /
analyzed: prativoḍhum na śaktā smaḥ śānta vākyasya te vacaḥ
translated: We are unable to respond to your peaceful words.

original: bhaktena kāryaṃ nāsmākaṃ pānena svādunā na ca //🔽bhaktād uccāra saṃbhavati pānān mūtraṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: bhaktena kāryam na asmākam pānena svādunā na ca  bhaktāt uccāra saṃbhavati pānāt mūtram tathā eva ca
translated: We have no need for food, nor for delicious drinks.🔽From food comes excrement, and from drink, urine.

original: śoṇitaṃ ca rasād bhavati raktān māṃsaṃ ca saṃbhavet //
analyzed: śoṇitam ca rasāt bhavati raktāt māṃsam ca saṃbhavet
translated: From juice comes blood, and from blood, flesh is produced.

original: nāsmākaṃ bhojanaṃ kāryaṃ pānenaiva ca saṃskṛtaṃ /🔽vastrāṇi naiva sūkṣmāṇi paṭṭāpaṭṭakasaṃhitā //
analyzed: na asmākam bhojanam kāryam pānena eva ca saṃskṛtam  vastrāṇi nā eva sūkṣmāṇi paṭṭa apaṭṭaka saṃhitā
translated: We have no need for food prepared with drink,🔽Nor for garments that are not fine, made of strips of cloth.

original: kaṭakāś ca na sauvarṇāḥ kāryā muktilatā na ca /
analyzed: kaṭakāḥ ca na sauvarṇāḥ kāryāḥ mukti latāḥ na ca
translated: And gold bracelets should not be worn, nor pearl necklaces.

analyzed: aṅgulīyaiḥ nā eva kāryam sarve te nitya dharmiṇaḥ
translated: Rings should not be worn, for all of them are impermanent by nature.

original: jīvitair arthikāś ca smaḥ na ca gacchema durgatim /
analyzed: jīvitaiḥ arthikāḥ ca smaḥ na ca gacchema durgatim
translated: We desire life and do not wish to go to the lower realms.

original: arthikā dharmadānena na devānāṃ sukhair api //
analyzed: arthikāḥ dharma dānena na devānām sukhaiḥ api
translated: We desire the gift of the Dharma, not even the happiness of the gods.

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra tā kāryā na rājyam cakravartinām
translated: We should be good friends, not the kings of the world.

analyzed: cakravartī mariṣyanti tyaktvā dvīpān su śobhanān
translated: The world-emperors will die, having abandoned their beautiful continents.

original: na putrāḥ pṛṣṭhato yānti na bhāryā na ca dhītarāḥ /
analyzed: na putrāḥ pṛṣṭhatas yānti na bhāryāḥ na ca dhītarāḥ
translated: Sons do not follow behind, nor wives nor daughters.

analyzed: sapta ratnāḥ nivartyante na api yāsyanti pṛṣṭhatas
translated: The seven treasures turn back, and they will not go behind.

original: sannipātya bahujano na ca yāsyanti pṛṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: sannipātya bahu janaḥ na ca yāsyanti pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Having gathered many people, they will not go behind.

original: purataś ca na dhāvante vaśaṃ bhūyo na vartate //
analyzed: puratas ca na dhāvante vaśam bhūyas na vartate
translated: They do not run in front, and they do not return to power again.

analyzed: ekajanmika rājānaḥ bhrāmitāḥ nityayā bahu
translated: The kings of one life, deluded by permanence,

original: kṛtvā pāpāni karmāṇi raurave prapatanti te //
analyzed: kṛtvā pāpāni karmāṇi raurave prapatanti te
translated: having committed evil deeds, fall into the Raurava [hell].

analyzed: caturdiśam paryaṭitvā sapta ratnaiḥ mahardhikaiḥ
translated: Having wandered in the four directions with the seven treasures of great power,

original: yāsyate kva ca sā ṛddhir yadā vatsyati raurave //
analyzed: yāsyate kva ca sā ṛddhiḥ yadā vatsyati raurave
translated: where will that power go when they dwell in the Raurava [hell]?

original: mṛtā ṛddhiṃ na śaknonti yatra bhūmir na vidyate /
analyzed: mṛtāḥ ṛddhim na śaknonti yatra bhūmiḥ na vidyate
translated: When dead, they cannot use their power, where the earth is not found.

original: sthavira śṛṇuṣva asmākaṃ gaccha yena tathāgataḥ //
analyzed: sthavira śṛṇuṣva asmākam gaccha yena tathāgataḥ
translated: Elder, listen to us, go to the Tathāgata.

original: kāṃkṣāma darśanaṃ tasya mātāpitror yathaiva hi /
analyzed: kāṃkṣāma darśanam tasya mātā pitroḥ yathā eva hi
translated: As for the mother and father, they desire to see him.

original: nāsmākaṃ vidyate mātā na pitā bhrātarau na ca //
analyzed: na asmākam vidyate mātā na pitā bhrātarau na ca
translated: We have no mother, no father, no brothers.

original: saiva lokagurur mātā pitā caiva tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: sā eva loka guruḥ mātā pitā ca eva tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is the world's teacher, the mother and father.

original: saiva candraś ca sūryaś ca kṣemamārgapradarśakaḥ //
analyzed: sā eva candraḥ ca sūryaḥ ca kṣema mārga pradarśakaḥ
translated: He is the moon and the sun, showing the path to safety.

original: mocakaḥ sa hi saṃsārād yena bhūyo na jāyate /
analyzed: mocakaḥ sa hi saṃsārāt yena bhūyas na jāyate
translated: He is the one who liberates from saṃsāra, from which one is not reborn.

original: sa nāvātārako oghāt kleśaughāc ca mahābhayāt //
analyzed: sa na avātārakaḥ oghāt kleśa oghāt ca mahā bhayāt
translated: He is the one who crosses the flood, the great fear of the flood of afflictions.

original: tena pratāritāḥ satvāḥ na bhūyo vinivartitā /
analyzed: tena pratāritāḥ satvāḥ na bhūyas vinivartitā
translated: The beings who have been crossed by him do not return again.

analyzed: saddharmaḥ deśitaḥ tena agra bodhi pradarśakaḥ
translated: He has taught the true Dharma, showing the supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: na asmākam bhojanena arthaḥ na rājya phala kāṃkṣiṇaḥ
translated: We have no need for food, nor do we desire the fruits of kingship.

analyzed: na deva loka gamanam kāryam naraka bhīrubhiḥ
translated: Those who fear hell should not go to the world of the gods.

original: sukhaṃ mānuṣyakaṃ janma dṛśyate yatra sarvavit /
analyzed: sukham mānuṣyakam janma dṛśyate yatra sarva vid
translated: The human birth is seen to be happy, where the Omniscient One is seen.

original: alpāyuṣāś ca dṛśyante duṣkṛtaiḥ karmabhiḥ svakaiḥ //
analyzed: alpa āyuṣāḥ ca dṛśyante duṣkṛtaiḥ karmabhiḥ svakaiḥ
translated: Those with short lifespans are seen due to their own evil deeds.

original: rajyante kāmabhogais te vindanti maraṇaṃ na ca /
analyzed: rajyante kāma bhogaiḥ te vindanti maraṇam na ca
translated: They delight in the enjoyment of sensual pleasures, but do not find death.

analyzed: jānanti na ca bhāyante nirodha utpāda vāṃcitāḥ
translated: They do not know and are not afraid, desiring cessation and origination.

original: sūkṣmān dharmān na jānanti sūkṣmaṃ kāryaṃ na kurvante /
analyzed: sūkṣmān dharmān na jānanti sūkṣmam kāryam na kurvante
translated: They do not know the subtle dharmas, they do not perform the subtle actions.

analyzed: śāntam dhātum na jānanti avidyā ākrānta cetasaḥ
translated: They do not know the peaceful realm, their minds are overwhelmed by ignorance.

original: cyavanto na ca khidyante jāyantaś ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: cyavantaḥ na ca khidyante jāyantaḥ ca punar punar
translated: They die and are not weary, and are born again and again.

analyzed: dīrgharātram duḥkha hatāḥ daṇḍa tāḍitāḥ
translated: For a long time they are afflicted by suffering, constantly beaten by the stick of impermanence.

analyzed: parakīyam hariṣyanti ghātyante bandhane tathā
translated: They will steal what belongs to others, and are killed and bound accordingly.

analyzed: paṃcabandhana baddhāḥ te pūrva pāpena coditāḥ
translated: Bound by the five bonds, urged on by their previous evil deeds,

analyzed: nirāśāḥ ca mariṣyanti śoka śalya samarpitā
translated: They will die in despair, their hearts pierced by the stake of grief.

analyzed: niruddhyamāne vijñāne karuṇam paridevate
translated: When consciousness is obstructed, he laments pitifully:

original: ko nu trātā bhaveyur me sarvān bhogān dadāmy ahaṃ /
analyzed: kaḥ nu trātā bhaveyuḥ me sarvān bhogān dadāmi aham
translated: Who will be my savior? I will give all my possessions.

analyzed: suvarṇa rupya sphaṭikam ca bhavāmi aham
translated: Gold, silver, crystal - I will even be your slave.

original: sarvaṃ karma kariṣyāmi dāsayogyaṃ ca yad bhavet /
analyzed: sarvam karma kariṣyāmi dāsa yogyam ca yat bhavet
translated: I will do all the work suitable for a slave.

original: na rājyabhogair me kāryaṃ na dhānyena dhanena ca //
analyzed: na rājya bhogaiḥ me kāryam na dhānyena dhanena ca
translated: I have no need for the enjoyments of a kingdom, nor for grain or wealth.

original: svaśarīreṇa me kāryaṃ pāpakārī na mucyate /
analyzed: sva śarīreṇa me kāryam pāpa kārī na mucyate
translated: I have need of my own body, one who commits evil is not freed.

original: evaṃ hi sthavirāsmākaṃ na kāryaṃ bhojanaṃ bhavet //
analyzed: evam hi sthavira asmākam na kāryam bhojanam bhavet
translated: Thus, for us elders, food should not be a concern.

analyzed: rājānaḥ pi mariṣyanti yaiḥ bhuktam mṛṣṭa bhojanam
translated: Even kings will die, by whom delicious food has been eaten.

original: devaputrā mariṣyanti pītvā vai pānam uttamam //
analyzed: deva putrāḥ mariṣyanti pītvā vai pānam uttamam
translated: Gods' sons will die, having drunk the best drink.

analyzed: nānā rasa māyuktam saṃskṛtam pāna bhojanam
translated: Food and drink prepared with various flavors,

original: ānīya purato rājā jihvayā spṛśati bhojana //
analyzed: ānīya puratas rājā jihvayā spṛśati bhojana
translated: The king touches with his tongue the food that has been brought before him.

original: rasagṛddhā hi rājānaḥ pāpaṃ kurvanty analpakaṃ /
analyzed: rasa gṛddhāḥ hi rājānaḥ pāpam kurvanti analpakam
translated: For kings, greedy for flavors, commit much evil.

original: rajyanty anityehi rasehi yatra sāraṃ na vidyate //
analyzed: rajyanti anityehi rasehi yatra sāram na vidyate
translated: They are attached to impermanent flavors, where there is no essence.

original: pānaṃ na kāryam asmākaṃ na ca kāryaṃ hi bhojanaṃ /
analyzed: pānam na kāryam asmākam na ca kāryam hi bhojanam
translated: We should not drink, nor should we eat.

original: dharmatā īdṛśī kāryā duḥkhān mucyema yad vayam //
analyzed: dharmatā īdṛśī kāryā duḥkhāt mucyema yat vayam
translated: Such a nature should be made, so that we may be freed from suffering.
Freed from the bondage of craving, liberated from the defilement of craving,

analyzed: sarva bandhana nirmuktam tam buddham śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: Freed from all bondage, we go for refuge to that Buddha.

original: vayaṃ hi śaraṇaṃ yāmo lokanāthaṃ maharṣiṇam /
analyzed: vayam hi śaraṇam yāmaḥ loka nātham mahā ṛṣiṇam
translated: We go for refuge to the protector of the world, the great sage,

analyzed: vandanāya vayam yāmaḥ satvānām priya darśanam
translated: We go to pay homage to the one who is dear to see for beings.

original: nāmaṃ tava na jānīmo nāmam ācakṣva śobhanaṃ /
analyzed: nāmam tava na jānīmaḥ nāmam ācakṣva śobhanam
translated: We do not know your name, please tell us your auspicious name.

analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-senā said:

original: yūyaṃ hi śrotum icchadhvaṃ nāmaṃ sarvajanasya ca //
analyzed: yūyam hi śrotum icchadhvam nāmam sarva janasya ca
translated: You all wish to hear the name of all people.

analyzed: vṛtaḥ koṭī śata sahasraiḥ navakaiḥ satvaiḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Surrounded by a hundred thousand koṭis of new beings, the Tathāgata

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: tava tu śrotum icchāmo nāmaṃ sarvaguṇodbhavaṃ //
analyzed: tava tu śrotum icchāmaḥ nāmam sarva guṇa udbhavam
translated: We wish to hear your name, which is the source of all good qualities.

original: gaṃbhīraṃ śrūyate nāma yas tvaṃ buddhānā śrāvakaḥ / āha /
analyzed: gaṃbhīram śrūyate nāma yaḥ tvam buddhānā śrāvakaḥ āha
translated: Your name is heard to be profound, and you are a disciple of the Buddhas. He said:

original: bhaiṣajyaseno nāmnāhaṃ satvānāṃ bhaiṣajyo hy ahaṃ //
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ nāmnā aham satvānām bhaiṣajyaḥ hi aham
translated: My name is Bhaiṣajyasena, for I am the medicine for beings.

analyzed: yuṣmākam deśayaiṣyāmi sarveṣām auṣadham varam
translated: I will teach you all the supreme medicine,

analyzed: sarva vyādhi praśamanam sarva vyādhi hate jane
translated: Which cures all illnesses for all people afflicted with illness.

original: rāgo vyādhir mahāvyādhir loke naśyati dāruṇaṃ /
analyzed: rāgaḥ vyādhiḥ mahā vyādhiḥ loke naśyati dāruṇam
translated: Passion is a great illness, a terrible illness that destroys the world.

original: moho vyādhir mahāghoro yena bhrāmyanty abuddhayaḥ //
analyzed: mohaḥ vyādhiḥ mahā ghoraḥ yena bhrāmyanti abuddhayaḥ
translated: Delusion is a very terrible illness, by which the unwise go astray.

original: vrajanti narakaṃ satvās tiryakpreteṣu vai tathā /
analyzed: vrajanti narakam satvāḥ tiryak preteṣu vai tathā
translated: Beings go to hell, and likewise to the animal realm and the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: dveṣagrastā ime bālās teṣāṃ śāntiḥ kathaṃ bhavet //
analyzed: dveṣa grastāḥ ime bālāḥ teṣām śāntiḥ katham bhavet
translated: These foolish ones are seized by hatred - how can there be peace for them?

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: mucyema sarvaduḥkhātaḥ śrutvā dharmam imaṃ śubhaṃ /
analyzed: mucyema sarva duḥkhātaḥ śrutvā dharmam imam śubham
translated: Having heard this auspicious Dharma, may we be freed from all suffering.

analyzed: muktāḥ ca sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ bāla buddhim a jānakāḥ
translated: Freed from all suffering, we who are ignorant and have the mind of a child,

analyzed: śroṣyāmahe dharma dānam pāpa karma vivarjitāḥ
translated: We will listen to the gift of the Dharma, abandoning evil actions.

analyzed: sarva pāpam vivarjitvā prahīṇa bhaya bhairavāḥ
translated: Having abandoned all evil, having eliminated fear and terror,

analyzed: drakṣyāma śīghram saṃbuddham sarva vyādhi pramocakam
translated: We will soon see the Perfectly Awakened One, the liberator from all illnesses,

analyzed: vaidya rājam mahā vaidyam duḥkhitānām cikitsakam
translated: The King of Physicians, the Great Physician, the healer of the suffering.

original: gaccha sthavira śīghraṃ tvaṃ vandanāya tathāgataṃ /
analyzed: gaccha sthavira śīghram tvam vandanāya tathāgatam
translated: Go quickly, Elder One, to pay homage to the Thus-Gone One.

analyzed: vandasva ca asmad vacanā brūhi loka vināyakam
translated: And speak these words of ours to the Guide of the World:

analyzed: praśāmaya imam vyādhim śamaya agnim su dāruṇam
translated: Quell this illness of ours, extinguish the extremely terrible fire.

original: kāyo 'yaṃ jvalitaḥ sarvo dahyamāno na śāmyate //
analyzed: kāyaḥ yam jvalitaḥ sarvaḥ dahyamānaḥ na śāmyate
translated: This entire body is burning, consumed by flames, not at peace.

analyzed: duḥkha arditānām asmākam kāryuṇyam kuru suvrata
translated: Have compassion on us who are afflicted by suffering, O One of Good Vows.

analyzed: kāya bhāraḥ mahā bhāraḥ tīkṣṇa bhāraḥ su dāruṇaḥ
translated: The burden of the body is a great burden, a sharp burden, extremely terrible.

analyzed: dveṣa moha samākrāntāḥ udvahanti janāḥ sadā
translated: People are always overwhelmed by hatred and delusion, carrying it.

original: punaḥ punar vahanty ete mokṣadvāram ajānakāḥ //
analyzed: punar punar vahanti ete mokṣa dvāram a jānakāḥ
translated: Again and again they carry it, those who do not know the door to liberation.

original: martavyaṃ na vijānante trāso notpadyate 'tha ca /
analyzed: martavyam na vijānante trāsaḥ na utpadyate ca
translated: They do not know that they will die, and therefore fear does not arise in them.

analyzed: mokṣa mārgam a jānānāḥ mokṣa mārgam apaśyakāḥ
translated: Not knowing the path to liberation, not seeing the path to liberation,

original: asmākaṃ maraṇaṃ nāsti kadācid iti susthitāḥ /
analyzed: asmākam maraṇam na asti kadācid iti susthitāḥ
translated: They are well-settled, thinking, We will never die.

original: saṃbhrāntā na vijānanti paśyanto mātaraṃ mṛtām //
analyzed: saṃbhrāntāḥ na vijānanti paśyantaḥ mātaram mṛtām
translated: Confused, they do not know, seeing their mother dead.

original: pitaraṃ na smaranty anye nityaṃ ca vyādhipīḍitāḥ /
analyzed: pitaram na smaranti anye nityam ca vyādhi pīḍitāḥ
translated: Others do not remember their father, always afflicted by disease.

analyzed: kleśa karma praluḍitāḥ katham bhūṃjāma bhojanam
translated: Disturbed by afflictions and karma, how do we eat food?

analyzed: duḥkhāntam na vijānāmaḥ nirarthakam
translated: We do not know the end of suffering, we strive in vain.

analyzed: asmākam īdṛśāḥ duḥkhāḥ jāti avidyā nidānataḥ
translated: Such are our sufferings, arising from ignorance and birth.

analyzed: mahā bhayam guru bhāram saṃjñā saṃskāra vedanā
translated: The great fear, the heavy burden, is perception, formation, and feeling.

original: tṛṣṇāyā bhrāmyate bālo yo dharmaṃ na vijānate //
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ bhrāmyate bālaḥ yaḥ dharmam na vijānate
translated: The fool wanders due to craving, who does not know the Dharma.

analyzed: jātaḥ loke hi anarthāya kāya bhāra parivṛtaḥ
translated: Born in the world for no purpose, surrounded by the burden of the body.

analyzed: snāna anulepanaiḥ kāryam śuciḥ vastram su śobhanam
translated: One should have bathing and anointing, pure and beautiful clothes.

original: mṛṣṭaṃ ca bhojanaṃ kāryaṃ yac charīre manoramaṃ /

analyzed: paṃca tūryā manojñam ca śrotram yācayate tathā

analyzed: māṃsa dvayam śarīreṇa niṣpīḍya ratī jāyate
translated: By squeezing the two pieces of flesh with the body, pleasure is produced.

original: kāyo hy acetano 'py eṣa ratiṃ kas tatra vindati /
analyzed: kāyaḥ hi acetanaḥ upi eṣa ratim kaḥ tatra vindati

analyzed: pādau me ramataḥ tatra prāvṛtam carma sundaram
translated: When I am delighted, my feet are covered with beautiful skin.

original: bhavanti maraṇe trāṇaṃ na vastraṃ na vilepanam /
analyzed: bhavanti maraṇe trāṇam na vastram na vilepanam
translated: In death, clothes and ointments are not a refuge,

translated: much less the body, let alone clothes and ointments.🔽A man is said to come to the body with great strength,

analyzed: tīkṣṇam balam pratisaṃkhyā tam tad śarīre mahā guṇam

analyzed: krīḍayā bhrāmitaḥ pūrvam aśva hasti parivṛtaḥ

analyzed: mokṣa dharmam a jānānaḥ rataḥ ham pāpa karmaṇi
translated: ignorant of the Dharma of liberation, I delighted in evil deeds.

analyzed: krīḍyā kārāpitam pāpam para lokam a jānatā
translated: Evil was done in play, not knowing about the next world,

original: punaḥ punaś ca jāto 'haṃ punar maraṇam āgataḥ //
analyzed: punar punar ca jātaḥ ham punar maraṇam āgataḥ
translated: and again and again I was born, and again I came to death.

analyzed: śokaḥ punar punar dṛṣṭam paridevita bandhanam
translated: Grief is seen again and again, and the bondage of lamenting,

original: mātṝṇāṃ maraṇaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭāś ca pitaro mṛtā //
analyzed: mātṝṇām maraṇam dṛṣṭam dṛṣṭāḥ ca pitaraḥ mṛtā
translated: the death of mothers is seen, and fathers are seen to die.

original: jñātayo bhaginī caiva putrā bhāryā mṛtāpi ca /
analyzed: jñātayaḥ bhaginī ca eva putrāḥ bhāryā mṛtā api ca

analyzed: śūnyāḥ sarve hi saṃskārāḥ kaḥ hi rajyet sa cetanaḥ

analyzed: viśvāsam hi mayā ajñātam lobha grastena cetasā

analyzed: śāntam dharmam na upalabdham maraṇam na abhinanditam
translated: I have not attained the peaceful Dharma, I do not delight in death.

original: tena dānaṃ na dattaṃ me lobhenāvṛtacetasā /
analyzed: tena dānam na dattam me lobhena āvṛta cetasā

analyzed: kaḥ syāḥ pāpaḥ yaḥ dyā api na nivartate

analyzed: saṃbhrāntāḥ śabdam śṛṇumaḥ asat dharma parigraham
translated: We hear the frightened sound, grasping at false teachings.

analyzed: mokṣam ca margāmaḥ śarīram na udvahāmahe

analyzed: buddhāḥ bhavema loka arthe śāstāraḥ guravaḥ jage

analyzed: buddhaḥ mātā pitā loke buddhaḥ mārga pradarśakaḥ

analyzed: pravarṣate dharma varṣam jaṃbudvīpe samantataḥ
translated: He rains down the rain of Dharma everywhere in Jambudvipa.

original: mūḍhā satvā na jānanti dharmāṇāṃ saṃgrahaṃ kathaṃ /

analyzed: bodhau cittam nāmayitvā labhyate dharma saṃgrahaḥ
translated: By directing the mind towards enlightenment, the gathering of the Dharma is attained.

original: śūnyatāḥ sarvasaṃkārāḥ śūnyā bhogā dhanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: śūnyatāḥ sarva saṃkārāḥ śūnyāḥ bhogāḥ dhanam tathā

analyzed: paśyāma śūnyam ātmānam dṛṣṭvā jātāḥ nirāśa tā

analyzed: sthavira bhaiṣajyasenam asmākam vacanam śṛṇu

original: dūraṃ ca te visarjemo bodhisatvāna kāraṇāt //
analyzed: dūram ca te visarjemaḥ kāraṇāt

analyzed: bodhisatvāḥ na khidyante vīryavantaḥ mahā tapāḥ

analyzed: smṛtvā saṃsāra doṣāṇi kurvante guṇa saṃgraham

original: gacchasva yena śāstāsau pṛccha cāsmāka kāranāt /

analyzed: pratibuddhā sukham śāstā mā kiṃcid khidyate jinaḥ

analyzed: parājitaḥ tvayā māraḥ sa balaḥ ca sa vāhanaḥ

analyzed: gacchasva śīghram sthavira asmākam hita kāraṇāt

analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha

analyzed: avalokayanti te ūrdhvam sthitāḥ paṃca anūnakāḥ

analyzed: sapta ratna samārūḍhāḥ ratna jāla su alaṃkṛtāḥ

analyzed: pṛcchanti sthaviram tatra kim etat iha dṛśyate

analyzed: bhaiṣajayasenaḥ āha
translated: Bhaiṣajyasena said,

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said,

analyzed: vanditaḥ loka pradyotaḥ bodhisatvaiḥ daśat diśaḥ

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They say:

analyzed: vilokaya lokanātha pūraya asmakam āśayam

analyzed: cittena smābhiḥ śāstā labdhāḥ tatas phalam

analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisatvaḥ āha

analyzed: na gandhaiḥ rajyate śāstā na mālyaiḥ na
translated: The Teacher is not attached to perfumes, garlands,

analyzed: bhagavān āha

analyzed: adya mahā dharma dundubhi śabdam prakariṣyanti
translated: They will proclaim the sound of the great Dharma drum.

original: adya mahādharmaprakārasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti / / paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena imāni kūṭāgārāṇi /
analyzed: adya mahā dharma prakāra samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena imāni kūṭāgārāṇi
translated: They will be endowed with the great Dharma teachings. Bhaiṣajyasena, do you see these multi-storied buildings?

analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ āha
translated: Bhaiṣajyasena said:

analyzed: paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: I see, Blessed One.

analyzed: paśyāmi sugata bhagavān āha
translated: I see, Sugata. The Blessed One said:

analyzed: adya ime bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ satvāḥ
translated: Today, Bhaiṣajyasena, these young beings,

analyzed: eṣu kūṭāgāreṣu abhiruhya
translated: having ascended into these kūṭāgāras,

analyzed: dharma abhisamayam anuprāpsyanti
translated: will attain the realization of the Dharma.

analyzed: adyā ime sarva kuśala dharma paripūrim kariṣyanti
translated: Today they will fulfill all the wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: adya mahā dharma dundubhim parāhaniṣyanti
translated: Today they will beat the great Dharma drum.

original: anekeṣāṃ ca devanikāyānām adya dharmābhisamayo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anekeṣām ca deva nikāyānām adya dharma abhisamayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And today there will be the realization of the Dharma for many classes of gods.

analyzed: bahūnām ca nairayikānām satvānām vinipāta saṃprasthitānām
translated: And for many beings in the hells who are on the way to downfall,

analyzed: tathāgata jñāna nirdeśam śrutvā
translated: having heard the teaching of the Tathāgata's knowledge,

analyzed: sarva saṃsāra parāṅmukha parājayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: there will be the defeat and turning away from all saṃsāra.🔽And at that time, by the old beings, by nine hundred and ninety thousand koṭis, the fruit of stream-entry was attained.

original: SaSūC / tasyām ca velāyāṃ vṛddhasatvair navānavatibhiḥ koṭīśasraiḥ srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāptaṃ / / te ca sarvadharmasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sasūc    tasyām ca velāyām vṛddha satvaiḥ navānavatibhiḥ koṭī śasraiḥ srotaāpatti phalam prāptam te ca sarva dharma samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will all be endowed with all wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena sarva duḥkha parivarjitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: All of them, Bhaiṣajyasena, will be free from all suffering.

analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena sarva tathāgata darśanam niṣpādayiṣyanti
translated: All of them, Bhaiṣajya-seņa, will accomplish the vision of all the Tathāgatas.🔽All of them, Bhaiṣajya-seņa, will be endowed with the great Dharma.

original: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena mahādharmasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti / / avalokaya bhaiṣajyasena caturdiśaṃ/
analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena mahā dharma samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti avalokaya bhaiṣajyasena caturdiśam
translated: Bhaiṣajya-seņa, look at the four directions.

original: SaSūC / avalokayati bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisatvo mahāsatvaḥ samantāc caturdiśaṃ /
analyzed: avalokayati bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ samantāt caturdiśam
translated: Bhaiṣajya-seņa, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, looked all around in the four directions.

analyzed: diśi paṃcāśat koṭī gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgacchanti
translated: In the eastern direction, bodhisattvas equal to the sands of fifty Ganges Rivers came.

original: dakṣiṇasyān diśi ṣaṣṭikoṭīgaṃgānadībālikāsamā bodhisatvā āgacchanti /🔽paścimasyāṃ diśi saptatikoṭīgaṃgānadībālikāsamā bodhisatvā āgacchanti /
analyzed: diśi ṣaṣṭi koṭī gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgacchanti  paścimasyām diśi saptati koṭī gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgacchanti
translated: In the southern direction, bodhisattvas equal to the sands of sixty Ganges Rivers came.🔽In the western direction, bodhisattvas equal to the sands of seventy Ganges Rivers came.

original: uttarasyān diśy aśītikoṭīgaṃgānadībālikāsamā bodhisatvā āgacchanti /🔽adhastāddiśi navatikoṭīsahasragaṃgānadībālikāsamā bodhisatvā āgacchanti /
analyzed: diśi aśīti koṭī gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgacchanti  adhastāt diśi navati koṭī sahasra gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgacchanti
translated: In the northern direction, bodhisattvas equal to the sands of eighty Ganges Rivers came.🔽In the lower direction, bodhisattvas equal to the sands of ninety thousand Ganges Rivers came.

analyzed: ūrdhvāyām diśi koṭī śata sahasra gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgacchanti
translated: In the upper direction, bodhisattvas equal to the sands of a hundred thousand Ganges Rivers came.

analyzed: te ca āgata āgatāḥ bodhisatvāḥ mahāsatvā
translated: And those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had come,

analyzed: mahābhagavataḥ pādau śiraśā abhivandya
translated: having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One,

analyzed: ekānte tasthuḥ
translated: they stood to one side.

original: SaSūC / ekāntasthitānāṃ daśadigbhya āgatānāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ mahāsatvānām /
analyzed: ekānta sthitānām daśa digbhyaḥ āgatānām bodhisatvānām mahāsatvānām
translated: While they were standing to one side, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpūrṇa,

original: atha bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisatvo mahāsatvo bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpūrṇa said this to the Blessed One:

original: kim etad bhagavan khagāntarīkṣe kṛṣṇarūpaṃ lohitarūpaṃ ca paśyāmi /
analyzed: kim etat bhagavan khaga antarīkṣe kṛṣṇa rūpam lohita rūpam ca paśyāmi
translated: What is this, Blessed One? In the sky I see a black form and a red form.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kim idam bhaiṣajyasena
translated: What is this, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpūrṇa?

original: na saṃjānāsi yad etad antarīkṣe kṛṣṇarūpaṃ lohitarūpaṃ ca paśyasi /
analyzed: na saṃjānāsi yat etat antarīkṣe kṛṣṇa rūpam lohita rūpam ca paśyasi
translated: Do you not understand that you see a black form and a red form in the sky?

analyzed: āha na jānāmi bhagavan
translated: He said: I do not know, Blessed One.

analyzed: na jānāmi sugata bhagavān āha
translated: I do not know, Sugata. The Blessed One said:

analyzed: eṣa tathāgataḥ eva jānāti
translated: Only the Tathāgata knows this.

original: māro 'yaṃ bhaiṣajyasena vicakṣuskaraṇāyehopasaṃkrāntaḥ / / icchasi bhaiṣajyasenaitān bodhisatvān mahāsatvān draṣṭuṃ ya ete khagāntarīkṣe vyavasthitāḥ /
analyzed: māraḥ yam bhaiṣajyasena vicakṣuḥ karaṇāya iha upasaṃkrāntaḥ icchasi bhaiṣajyasena etān bodhisatvān mahāsatvān draṣṭum ye ete khaga antarīkṣe vyavasthitāḥ
translated: This is Māra, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpūrṇa, who has come here to cause blindness. Do you wish to see those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are standing in the sky?

analyzed: āha icchāmi bhagavan
translated: He said: I wish to, Blessed One.

analyzed: icchāmi sugata
translated: I wish to, Sugata.

analyzed: sasūc
translated: Then the Blessed One,

analyzed: tān bodhisatvān darśayitvā
translated: having shown those bodhisattvas,

analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisatvam mahāsatvam āmantrayati sma
translated: He addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada:

original: īdṛśā bhaiṣajyasena gaṃgānadībālikāsamā bodhisatvā āgatāḥ / / āha /
analyzed: īdṛśāḥ bhaiṣajyasena gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ āgatāḥ āha
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, bodhisattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges have come. He said:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yad ete bodhisatvā etāvanta ihāgatāḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat ete bodhisatvāḥ etāvantaḥ iha āgatāḥ
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, that these bodhisattvas have come here in such great numbers?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: daharāṇāṃ satvānāṃ pratyayena bhaiṣajyasena saṃprātaṃ sarvasatvā dharmadhyānasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti / / paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena /
analyzed: daharāṇām satvānām pratyayena bhaiṣajyasena saṃprātam sarva satvāḥ dharma dhyāna samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, it is through the condition of young beings that all beings will be endowed with the meditation on the Dharma. Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, do you see

original: bodhisatvā nānāṛddhibalā āgatā / / avalokitā mayā koṭīśatagaṃgānadībālikāsamā lokadhātavas /
analyzed: bodhisatvāḥ nānā ṛddhi balāḥ āgatāḥ avalokitāḥ mayā koṭī śata gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ
translated: the bodhisattvas who have come with various miraculous powers? I have surveyed world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

original: tatra mayā koṭīnayutaśatasahasragaṃgānadībālikāsamā bodhisatvā mahāsatvā dṛṣṭāḥ / / svakasvakena ṛddhibalena tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tatra mayā koṭī nayuta śata sahasra gaṃgā nadī bālikā samāḥ bodhisatvāḥ mahāsatvāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ svaka svakena ṛddhi balena tiṣṭhanti
translated: There I have seen bodhisattva mahāsattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in a koṭi of nayutas of hundreds of thousands. They stand in their own miraculous powers.

analyzed: nānā rūpā
translated: They have various forms.

analyzed: nānā varṇā
translated: They have various colors.

original: nānābalasaṃsthānās tiṣṭhanti / / āryadharmavihāreṣu te bodhisatvās tiṣṭhanti / dharmavihāreṣu te bodhisatvaparivārās tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: nānā bala saṃsthānāḥ tiṣṭhanti ārya dharmavihāreṣu te bodhisatvāḥ tiṣṭhanti dharmavihāreṣu te bodhisatva parivārāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: They stand with various strengths and shapes. Those bodhisattvas stand in the noble abodes of the Dharma. Those retinues of bodhisattvas stand in the abodes of the Dharma.

original: SaSūC / idam avocad bhagavān āttamanāḥ / / sarvaśuro bodhisatvo mahāsatvaḥ /
analyzed: sasūc   idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ sarvaśuraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Sarvaśūra,

analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ
translated: the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyasena,

analyzed: sarve ca nava purāṇakāḥ bodhisatvāḥ mahāsatvāḥ
translated: and all the old and new Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas,

analyzed: sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad
translated: and the entire assembly,

original: sadevamanuṣāsuragandharvaś ca loko bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandat / / / saṃghāṭaṃ nāma mahāyānasūtraṃ samāptam /
analyzed: sa deva manuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandat         nāma mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in the Blessed One's words. The Mahāyāna Sūtra called the Saṃghāṭa is complete.

original: Colophon D / // // āryasaṃghāṭaṃ nāma dharmmaparyāyaṃ samāptam ////
analyzed: colophon d ārya saṃghāṭam nāma dharmmaparyāyam samāptam
translated: Colophon D... The noble Dharma discourse called the Saṃghāṭa is complete.
